41011011	Jesus entered Jerusalem and went into the temple courts . He looked around at everything , but since it was already late , he went out to Bethany with the Twelve .
41011012	The next day as they were leaving Bethany , Jesus was hungry .
41011013	Seeing in the distance a fig-tree in leaf , he went to find out if it had any fruit . When he reached it , he found nothing but leaves , because it was not the season for figs .
41011014	Then he said to the tree , ‘ May no one ever eat fruit from you again . ’ And his disciples heard him say it .
41011015	On reaching Jerusalem , Jesus entered the temple courts and began driving out those who were buying and selling there . He overturned the tables of the money-changers and the benches of those selling doves ,
41011016	and would not allow anyone to carry merchandise through the temple courts .
41011017	And as he taught them , he said , ‘ Is it not written : “ My house will be called a house of prayer for all nations ” ? But you have made it “ a den of robbers ” . ’
41011018	The chief priests and the teachers of the law heard this and began looking for a way to kill him , for they feared him , because the whole crowd was amazed at his teaching .
41011019	When evening came , Jesus and his disciples went out of the city .
41011020	In the morning , as they went along , they saw the fig-tree withered from the roots .
41011021	Peter remembered and said to Jesus , ‘ Rabbi , look ! The fig-tree you cursed has withered ! ’
41011022	‘ Have faith in God , ’ Jesus answered .
41011023	‘ Truly I tell you , if anyone says to this mountain , “ Go , throw yourself into the sea , ” and does not doubt in their heart but believes that what they say will happen , it will be done for them .
41011024	Therefore I tell you , whatever you ask for in prayer , believe that you have received it , and it will be yours .
41011025	And when you stand praying , if you hold anything against anyone , forgive them , so that your Father in heaven may forgive you your sins . ’ [
41011027	They arrived again in Jerusalem , and while Jesus was walking in the temple courts , the chief priests , the teachers of the law and the elders came to him .
41011028	‘ By what authority are you doing these things ? ’ they asked . ‘ And who gave you authority to do this ? ’
41011029	Jesus replied , ‘ I will ask you one question . Answer me , and I will tell you by what authority I am doing these things .
41011030	John’s baptism – was it from heaven , or of human origin ? Tell me ! ’
41011031	They discussed it among themselves and said , ‘ If we say , “ From heaven , ” he will ask , “ Then why didn’t you believe him ? ”
41011032	But if we say , “ Of human origin ” … ’ ( They feared the people , for everyone held that John really was a prophet . )
41011033	So they answered Jesus , ‘ We don’t know . ’ Jesus said , ‘ Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things . ’
41012001	Jesus then began to speak to them in parables : ‘ A man planted a vineyard . He put a wall round it , dug a pit for the winepress and built a watchtower . Then he rented the vineyard to some farmers and moved to another place .
41012002	At harvest time he sent a servant to the tenants to collect from them some of the fruit of the vineyard .
41012003	But they seized him , beat him and sent him away empty-handed .
41012004	Then he sent another servant to them ; they struck this man on the head and treated him shamefully .
41012005	He sent still another , and that one they killed . He sent many others ; some of them they beat , others they killed .
41012006	‘ He had one left to send , a son , whom he loved . He sent him last of all , saying , “ They will respect my son . ”
41012007	‘ But the tenants said to one another , “ This is the heir . Come , let’s kill him , and the inheritance will be ours . ”
41012008	So they took him and killed him , and threw him out of the vineyard .
41012009	‘ What then will the owner of the vineyard do ? He will come and kill those tenants and give the vineyard to others .
41012010	Haven’t you read this passage of Scripture : ‘ “ The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone ;
41012011	the Lord has done this , and it is marvellous in our eyes ” ? ’
41012012	Then the chief priests , the teachers of the law and the elders looked for a way to arrest him because they knew he had spoken the parable against them . But they were afraid of the crowd ; so they left him and went away .
41012013	Later they sent some of the Pharisees and Herodians to Jesus to catch him in his words .
41012014	They came to him and said , ‘ Teacher , we know that you are a man of integrity . You aren’t swayed by others , because you pay no attention to who they are ; but you teach the way of God in accordance with the truth . Is it right to pay the poll-tax to Caesar or not ?
41012015	Should we pay or shouldn’t we ? ’ But Jesus knew their hypocrisy . ‘ Why are you trying to trap me ? ’ he asked . ‘ Bring me a denarius and let me look at it . ’
41012016	They brought the coin , and he asked them , ‘ Whose image is this ? And whose inscription ? ’ ‘ Caesar’s , ’ they replied .
41012017	Then Jesus said to them , ‘ Give back to Caesar what is Caesar’s and to God what is God’s . ’ And they were amazed at him .
41012018	Then the Sadducees , who say there is no resurrection , came to him with a question .
41012019	‘ Teacher , ’ they said , ‘ Moses wrote for us that if a man’s brother dies and leaves a wife but no children , the man must marry the widow and raise up offspring for his brother .
41012020	Now there were seven brothers . The first one married and died without leaving any children .
41012021	The second one married the widow , but he also died , leaving no child . It was the same with the third .
41012022	In fact , none of the seven left any children . Last of all , the woman died too .
41012023	At the resurrection whose wife will she be , since the seven were married to her ? ’
41012024	Jesus replied , ‘ Are you not in error because you do not know the Scriptures or the power of God ?
41012025	When the dead rise , they will neither marry nor be given in marriage ; they will be like the angels in heaven .
41012026	Now about the dead rising – have you not read in the Book of Moses , in the account of the burning bush , how God said to him , “ I am the God of Abraham , the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob ” ?
41012027	He is not the God of the dead , but of the living . You are badly mistaken ! ’
41012028	One of the teachers of the law came and heard them debating . Noticing that Jesus had given them a good answer , he asked him , ‘ Of all the commandments , which is the most important ? ’
41012029	‘ The most important one , ’ answered Jesus , ‘ is this : “ Hear , O Israel : the Lord our God , the Lord is one .
41012030	Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind and with all your strength . ”
41012031	The second is this : “ Love your neighbour as yourself . ” There is no commandment greater than these . ’
41012032	‘ Well said , teacher , ’ the man replied . ‘ You are right in saying that God is one and there is no other but him .
41012033	To love him with all your heart , with all your understanding and with all your strength , and to love your neighbour as yourself is more important than all burnt offerings and sacrifices . ’
41012034	When Jesus saw that he had answered wisely , he said to him , ‘ You are not far from the kingdom of God . ’ And from then on no one dared ask him any more questions .
41012035	While Jesus was teaching in the temple courts , he asked , ‘ Why do the teachers of the law say that the Messiah is the son of David ?
41012036	David himself , speaking by the Holy Spirit , declared : ‘ “ The Lord said to my Lord : ‘ Sit at my right hand until I put your enemies under your feet . ’ ” The large crowd listened to him with delight .
41012038	As he taught , Jesus said , ‘ Watch out for the teachers of the law . They like to walk around in flowing robes and be greeted with respect in the market-places ,
41012039	and have the most important seats in the synagogues and the places of honour at banquets .
41012040	They devour widows’ houses and for a show make lengthy prayers . These men will be punished most severely . ’
41012041	Jesus sat down opposite the place where the offerings were put and watched the crowd putting their money into the temple treasury . Many rich people threw in large amounts .
41012042	But a poor widow came and put in two very small copper coins , worth only a few pence .
41012043	Calling his disciples to him , Jesus said , ‘ Truly I tell you , this poor widow has put more into the treasury than all the others .
41012044	They all gave out of their wealth ; but she , out of her poverty , put in everything – all she had to live on . ’
41013001	As Jesus was leaving the temple , one of his disciples said to him , ‘ Look , Teacher ! What massive stones ! What magnificent buildings ! ’
41013002	‘ Do you see all these great buildings ? ’ replied Jesus . ‘ Not one stone here will be left on another ; every one will be thrown down . ’
41013003	As Jesus was sitting on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple , Peter , James , John and Andrew asked him privately ,
41013004	‘ Tell us , when will these things happen ? And what will be the sign that they are all about to be fulfilled ? ’
41013005	Jesus said to them : ‘ Watch out that no one deceives you .
41013006	Many will come in my name , claiming , “ I am he , ” and will deceive many .
41013007	When you hear of wars and rumours of wars , do not be alarmed . Such things must happen , but the end is still to come .
41013008	Nation will rise against nation , and kingdom against kingdom . There will be earthquakes in various places , and famines . These are the beginning of birth-pains .
41013009	‘ You must be on your guard . You will be handed over to the local councils and flogged in the synagogues . On account of me you will stand before governors and kings as witnesses to them .
41013010	And the gospel must first be preached to all nations .
41013011	Whenever you are arrested and brought to trial , do not worry beforehand about what to say . Just say whatever is given you at the time , for it is not you speaking , but the Holy Spirit .
41013012	‘ Brother will betray brother to death , and a father his child . Children will rebel against their parents and have them put to death .
41013013	Everyone will hate you because of me , but the one who stands firm to the end will be saved .
41013014	‘ When you see “ the abomination that causes desolation ” standing where it does not belong – let the reader understand – then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains .
41013015	Let no one on the housetop go down or enter the house to take anything out .
41013016	Let no one in the field go back to get their cloak .
41013017	How dreadful it will be in those days for pregnant women and nursing mothers !
41013018	Pray that this will not take place in winter ,
41013019	because those will be days of distress unequalled from the beginning , when God created the world , until now – and never to be equalled again .
41013020	‘ If the Lord had not cut short those days , no one would survive . But for the sake of the elect , whom he has chosen , he has shortened them .
41013021	At that time if anyone says to you , “ Look , here is the Messiah ! ” or , “ Look , there he is ! ” do not believe it .
41013022	For false messiahs and false prophets will appear and perform signs and wonders to deceive , if possible , even the elect .
41013023	So be on your guard ; I have told you everything in advance .
41013024	‘ But in those days , following that distress , ‘ “ the sun will be darkened , and the moon will not give its light ;
41013025	the stars will fall from the sky , and the heavenly bodies will be shaken . ”
41013026	‘ At that time people will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory .
41013027	And he will send his angels and gather his elect from the four winds , from the ends of the earth to the ends of the heavens .
41013028	‘ Now learn this lesson from the fig-tree : As soon as its twigs get tender and its leaves come out , you know that summer is near .
41013029	Even so , when you see these things happening , you know that it is near , right at the door .
41013030	Truly I tell you , this generation will certainly not pass away until all these things have happened .
41013031	Heaven and earth will pass away , but my words will never pass away .
41013032	‘ But about that day or hour no one knows , not even the angels in heaven , nor the Son , but only the Father .
41013033	Be on guard ! Be alert ! You do not know when that time will come .
41013034	It’s like a man going away : he leaves his house and puts his servants in charge , each with their assigned task , and tells the one at the door to keep watch .
41013035	‘ Therefore keep watch because you do not know when the owner of the house will come back – whether in the evening , or at midnight , or when the cock crows , or at dawn .
41013036	If he comes suddenly , do not let him find you sleeping .
41013037	What I say to you , I say to everyone : “ Watch ! ” ’
41014001	Now the Passover and the Festival of Unleavened Bread were only two days away , and the chief priests and the teachers of the law were scheming to arrest Jesus secretly and kill him .
41014002	‘ But not during the festival , ’ they said , ‘ or the people may riot . ’
41014003	While he was in Bethany , reclining at the table in the home of Simon the Leper , a woman came with an alabaster jar of very expensive perfume , made of pure nard . She broke the jar and poured the perfume on his head .
41014004	Some of those present were saying indignantly to one another , ‘ Why this waste of perfume ?
41014005	It could have been sold for more than a year’s wages and the money given to the poor . ’ And they rebuked her harshly .
41014006	‘ Leave her alone , ’ said Jesus . ‘ Why are you bothering her ? She has done a beautiful thing to me .
41014007	The poor you will always have with you , and you can help them any time you want . But you will not always have me .
41014008	She did what she could . She poured perfume on my body beforehand to prepare for my burial .
41014009	Truly I tell you , wherever the gospel is preached throughout the world , what she has done will also be told , in memory of her . ’
41014010	Then Judas Iscariot , one of the Twelve , went to the chief priests to betray Jesus to them .
41014011	They were delighted to hear this and promised to give him money . So he watched for an opportunity to hand him over .
41014012	On the first day of the Festival of Unleavened Bread , when it was customary to sacrifice the Passover lamb , Jesus’ disciples asked him , ‘ Where do you want us to go and make preparations for you to eat the Passover ? ’
41014013	So he sent two of his disciples , telling them , ‘ Go into the city , and a man carrying a jar of water will meet you . Follow him .
41014014	Say to the owner of the house he enters , “ The Teacher asks : where is my guest room , where I may eat the Passover with my disciples ? ”
41014015	He will show you a large room upstairs , furnished and ready . Make preparations for us there . ’
41014016	The disciples left , went into the city and found things just as Jesus had told them . So they prepared the Passover .
41014017	When evening came , Jesus arrived with the Twelve .
41014018	While they were reclining at the table eating , he said , ‘ Truly I tell you , one of you will betray me – one who is eating with me . ’
41014019	They were saddened , and one by one they said to him , ‘ Surely you don’t mean me ? ’
41014020	‘ It is one of the Twelve , ’ he replied , ‘ one who dips bread into the bowl with me .
41014021	The Son of Man will go just as it is written about him . But woe to that man who betrays the Son of Man ! It would be better for him if he had not been born . ’
41014022	While they were eating , Jesus took bread , and when he had given thanks , he broke it and gave it to his disciples , saying , ‘ Take it ; this is my body . ’
41014023	Then he took a cup , and when he had given thanks , he gave it to them , and they all drank from it .
41014024	‘ This is my blood of the covenant , which is poured out for many , ’ he said to them .
41014025	‘ Truly I tell you , I will not drink again from the fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God . ’
41014026	When they had sung a hymn , they went out to the Mount of Olives .
41014027	‘ You will all fall away , ’ Jesus told them , ‘ for it is written : ‘ “ I will strike the shepherd , and the sheep will be scattered . ”
41014029	Peter declared , ‘ Even if all fall away , I will not . ’
41014030	‘ Truly I tell you , ’ Jesus answered , ‘ today – yes , tonight – before the cock crows twice you yourself will disown me three times . ’
41014031	But Peter insisted emphatically , ‘ Even if I have to die with you , I will never disown you . ’ And all the others said the same .
41014032	They went to a place called Gethsemane , and Jesus said to his disciples , ‘ Sit here while I pray . ’
41014033	He took Peter , James and John along with him , and he began to be deeply distressed and troubled .
41014034	‘ My soul is overwhelmed with sorrow to the point of death , ’ he said to them . ‘ Stay here and keep watch . ’
41014035	Going a little farther , he fell to the ground and prayed that if possible the hour might pass from him .
41014036	‘ Abba , Father , ’ he said , ‘ everything is possible for you . Take this cup from me . Yet not what I will , but what you will . ’
41014037	Then he returned to his disciples and found them sleeping . ‘ Simon , ’ he said to Peter , ‘ are you asleep ? Couldn’t you keep watch for one hour ?
41014038	Watch and pray so that you will not fall into temptation . The spirit is willing , but the flesh is weak . ’
41014039	Once more he went away and prayed the same thing .
41014040	When he came back , he again found them sleeping , because their eyes were heavy . They did not know what to say to him .
41014041	Returning the third time , he said to them , ‘ Are you still sleeping and resting ? Enough ! The hour has come . Look , the Son of Man is delivered into the hands of sinners .
41014042	Rise ! Let us go ! Here comes my betrayer ! ’
41014043	Just as he was speaking , Judas , one of the Twelve , appeared . With him was a crowd armed with swords and clubs , sent from the chief priests , the teachers of the law , and the elders .
41014044	Now the betrayer had arranged a signal with them : ‘ The one I kiss is the man ; arrest him and lead him away under guard . ’
41014045	Going at once to Jesus , Judas said , ‘ Rabbi ! ’ and kissed him .
41014046	The men seized Jesus and arrested him .
41014047	Then one of those standing near drew his sword and struck the servant of the high priest , cutting off his ear .
41014048	‘ Am I leading a rebellion , ’ said Jesus , ‘ that you have come out with swords and clubs to capture me ?
41014049	Every day I was with you , teaching in the temple courts , and you did not arrest me . But the Scriptures must be fulfilled . ’
41014050	Then everyone deserted him and fled .
41014051	A young man , wearing nothing but a linen garment , was following Jesus . When they seized him ,
41014052	he fled naked , leaving his garment behind .
41014053	They took Jesus to the high priest , and all the chief priests , the elders and the teachers of the law came together .
41014054	Peter followed him at a distance , right into the courtyard of the high priest . There he sat with the guards and warmed himself at the fire .
41014055	The chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for evidence against Jesus so that they could put him to death , but they did not find any .
41014056	Many testified falsely against him , but their statements did not agree .
41014057	Then some stood up and gave this false testimony against him :
41014058	‘ We heard him say , “ I will destroy this temple made with human hands and in three days will build another , not made with hands . ” ’
41014059	Yet even then their testimony did not agree .
41014060	Then the high priest stood up before them and asked Jesus , ‘ Are you not going to answer ? What is this testimony that these men are bringing against you ? ’
41014061	But Jesus remained silent and gave no answer . Again the high priest asked him , ‘ Are you the Messiah , the Son of the Blessed One ? ’
41014062	‘ I am , ’ said Jesus . ‘ And you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Mighty One and coming on the clouds of heaven . ’
41014063	The high priest tore his clothes . ‘ Why do we need any more witnesses ? ’ he asked .
41014064	‘ You have heard the blasphemy . What do you think ? ’ They all condemned him as worthy of death .
41014065	Then some began to spit at him ; they blindfolded him , struck him with their fists , and said , ‘ Prophesy ! ’ And the guards took him and beat him .
41014066	While Peter was below in the courtyard , one of the servant-girls of the high priest came by .
41014067	When she saw Peter warming himself , she looked closely at him . ‘ You also were with that Nazarene , Jesus , ’ she said .
41014068	But he denied it . ‘ I don’t know or understand what you’re talking about , ’ he said , and went out into the entrance .
41014069	When the servant-girl saw him there , she said again to those standing round them , ‘ This fellow is one of them . ’
41014070	Again he denied it . After a little while , those standing near said to Peter , ‘ Surely you are one of them , for you are a Galilean . ’
41014071	He began to call down curses , and he swore to them , ‘ I don’t know this man you’re talking about . ’
41014072	Immediately the cock crowed the second time . Then Peter remembered the word Jesus had spoken to him : ‘ Before the cock crows twice you will disown me three times . ’ And he broke down and wept .
41015001	Very early in the morning , the chief priests , with the elders , the teachers of the law and the whole Sanhedrin , made their plans . So they bound Jesus , led him away and handed him over to Pilate .
41015002	‘ Are you the king of the Jews ? ’ asked Pilate . ‘ You have said so , ’ Jesus replied .
41015003	The chief priests accused him of many things .
41015004	So again Pilate asked him , ‘ Aren’t you going to answer ? See how many things they are accusing you of . ’
41015005	But Jesus still made no reply , and Pilate was amazed .
41015006	Now it was the custom at the festival to release a prisoner whom the people requested .
41015007	A man called Barabbas was in prison with the rebels who had committed murder in the uprising .
41015008	The crowd came up and asked Pilate to do for them what he usually did .
41015009	‘ Do you want me to release to you the king of the Jews ? ’ asked Pilate ,
41015010	knowing it was out of self-interest that the chief priests had handed Jesus over to him .
41015011	But the chief priests stirred up the crowd to get Pilate to release Barabbas instead .
41015012	‘ What shall I do , then , with the one you call the king of the Jews ? ’ Pilate asked them .
41015013	‘ Crucify him ! ’ they shouted .
41015014	‘ Why ? What crime has he committed ? ’ asked Pilate . But they shouted all the louder , ‘ Crucify him ! ’
41015015	Wanting to satisfy the crowd , Pilate released Barabbas to them . He had Jesus flogged , and handed him over to be crucified .
41015016	The soldiers led Jesus away into the palace ( that is , the Praetorium ) and called together the whole company of soldiers .
41015017	They put a purple robe on him , then twisted together a crown of thorns and set it on him .
41015018	And they began to call out to him , ‘ Hail , king of the Jews ! ’
41015019	Again and again they struck him on the head with a staff and spat on him . Falling on their knees , they paid homage to him .
41015020	And when they had mocked him , they took off the purple robe and put his own clothes on him . Then they led him out to crucify him .
41015021	A certain man from Cyrene , Simon , the father of Alexander and Rufus , was passing by on his way in from the country , and they forced him to carry the cross .
41015022	They brought Jesus to the place called Golgotha ( which means ‘ the place of the skull ’ ) .
41015023	Then they offered him wine mixed with myrrh , but he did not take it .
41015024	And they crucified him . Dividing up his clothes , they cast lots to see what each would get .
41015025	It was nine in the morning when they crucified him .
41015026	The written notice of the charge against him read : the king of the jews .
41015027	They crucified two rebels with him , one on his right and one on his left . [
41015029	Those who passed by hurled insults at him , shaking their heads and saying , ‘ So ! You who are going to destroy the temple and build it in three days ,
41015030	come down from the cross and save yourself ! ’
41015031	In the same way the chief priests and the teachers of the law mocked him among themselves . ‘ He saved others , ’ they said , ‘ but he can’t save himself !
41015032	Let this Messiah , this king of Israel , come down now from the cross , that we may see and believe . ’ Those crucified with him also heaped insults on him .
41015033	At noon , darkness came over the whole land until three in the afternoon .
41015034	And at three in the afternoon Jesus cried out in a loud voice , ‘ Eloi , Eloi , lema sabachthani ? ’ ( which means ‘ My God , my God , why have you forsaken me ? ’ ) .
41015035	When some of those standing near heard this , they said , ‘ Listen , he’s calling Elijah . ’
41015036	Someone ran , filled a sponge with wine vinegar , put it on a staff , and offered it to Jesus to drink . ‘ Now leave him alone . Let’s see if Elijah comes to take him down , ’ he said .
41015037	With a loud cry , Jesus breathed his last .
41015038	The curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom .
41015039	And when the centurion , who stood there in front of Jesus , saw how he died , he said , ‘ Surely this man was the Son of God ! ’
41015040	Some women were watching from a distance . Among them were Mary Magdalene , Mary the mother of James the younger and of Joseph , and Salome .
41015041	In Galilee these women had followed him and cared for his needs . Many other women who had come up with him to Jerusalem were also there .
41015042	It was Preparation Day ( that is , the day before the Sabbath ) . So as evening approached ,
41015043	Joseph of Arimathea , a prominent member of the Council , who was himself waiting for the kingdom of God , went boldly to Pilate and asked for Jesus’ body .
41015044	Pilate was surprised to hear that he was already dead . Summoning the centurion , he asked him if Jesus had already died .
41015045	When he learned from the centurion that it was so , he gave the body to Joseph .
41015046	So Joseph bought some linen cloth , took down the body , wrapped it in the linen , and placed it in a tomb cut out of rock . Then he rolled a stone against the entrance of the tomb .
41015047	Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joseph saw where he was laid .
41016001	When the Sabbath was over , Mary Magdalene , Mary the mother of James , and Salome bought spices so that they might go to anoint Jesus’ body .
41016002	Very early on the first day of the week , just after sunrise , they were on their way to the tomb
41016003	and they asked each other , ‘ Who will roll the stone away from the entrance of the tomb ? ’
41016004	But when they looked up , they saw that the stone , which was very large , had been rolled away .
41016005	As they entered the tomb , they saw a young man dressed in a white robe sitting on the right side , and they were alarmed .
41016006	‘ Don’t be alarmed , ’ he said . ‘ You are looking for Jesus the Nazarene , who was crucified . He has risen ! He is not here . See the place where they laid him .
41016007	But go , tell his disciples and Peter , “ He is going ahead of you into Galilee . There you will see him , just as he told you . ” ’
41016008	Trembling and bewildered , the women went out and fled from the tomb . They said nothing to anyone , because they were afraid .
41016009	When Jesus rose early on the first day of the week , he appeared first to Mary Magdalene , out of whom he had driven seven demons .
41016010	She went and told those who had been with him and who were mourning and weeping .
41016011	When they heard that Jesus was alive and that she had seen him , they did not believe it .
41016012	Afterwards Jesus appeared in a different form to two of them while they were walking in the country .
41016013	These returned and reported it to the rest ; but they did not believe them either .
41016014	Later Jesus appeared to the Eleven as they were eating ; he rebuked them for their lack of faith and their stubborn refusal to believe those who had seen him after he had risen .
41016015	He said to them , ‘ Go into all the world and preach the gospel to all creation .
41016016	Whoever believes and is baptised will be saved , but whoever does not believe will be condemned .
41016017	And these signs will accompany those who believe : in my name they will drive out demons ; they will speak in new tongues ;
41016018	they will pick up snakes with their hands ; and when they drink deadly poison , it will not hurt them at all ; they will place their hands on people who are ill , and they will get well . ’
41016019	After the Lord Jesus had spoken to them , he was taken up into heaven and he sat at the right hand of God .
41016020	Then the disciples went out and preached everywhere , and the Lord worked with them and confirmed his word by the signs that accompanied it .
42001001	Many have undertaken to draw up an account of the things that have been fulfilled among us ,
42001002	just as they were handed down to us by those who from the first were eye witnesses and servants of the word .
42001003	With this in mind , since I myself have carefully investigated everything from the beginning , I too decided to write an orderly account for you , most excellent Theophilus ,
42001004	so that you may know the certainty of the things you have been taught .
42001005	In the time of Herod king of Judea there was a priest named Zechariah , who belonged to the priestly division of Abijah ; his wife Elizabeth was also a descendant of Aaron .
42001006	Both of them were righteous in the sight of God , observing all the Lord’s commands and decrees blamelessly .
42001007	But they were childless because Elizabeth was not able to conceive , and they were both very old .
42001008	Once when Zechariah’s division was on duty and he was serving as priest before God ,
42001009	he was chosen by lot , according to the custom of the priesthood , to go into the temple of the Lord and burn incense .
42001010	And when the time for the burning of incense came , all the assembled worshippers were praying outside .

42003001	In the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar – when Pontius Pilate was governor of Judea , Herod tetrarch of Galilee , his brother Philip tetrarch of Iturea and Traconitis , and Lysanias tetrarch of Abilene –

42006040	The student is not above the teacher , but everyone who is fully trained will be like their teacher .
42006041	‘ Why do you look at the speck of sawdust in your brother’s eye and pay no attention to the plank in your own eye ?
42006042	How can you say to your brother , “ Brother , let me take the speck out of your eye , ” when you yourself fail to see the plank in your own eye ? You hypocrite , first take the plank out of your eye , and then you will see clearly to remove the speck from your brother’s eye .
42006043	‘ No good tree bears bad fruit , nor does a bad tree bear good fruit .
42006044	Each tree is recognised by its own fruit . People do not pick figs from thorn-bushes , or grapes from briers .
42006045	A good man brings good things out of the good stored up in his heart , and an evil man brings evil things out of the evil stored up in his heart . For the mouth speaks what the heart is full of .
42006046	‘ Why do you call me , “ Lord , Lord , ” and do not do what I say ?
42006047	As for everyone who comes to me and hears my words and puts them into practice , I will show you what they are like .
42006048	They are like a man building a house , who dug down deep and laid the foundation on rock . When the flood came , the torrent struck that house but could not shake it , because it was well built .
42006049	But the one who hears my words and does not put them into practice is like a man who built a house on the ground without a foundation . The moment the torrent struck that house , it collapsed and its destruction was complete . ’
42007001	When Jesus had finished saying all this to the people who were listening , he entered Capernaum .
42007002	There a centurion’s servant , whom his master valued highly , was ill and about to die .
42007003	The centurion heard of Jesus and sent some elders of the Jews to him , asking him to come and heal his servant .
42007004	When they came to Jesus , they pleaded earnestly with him , ‘ This man deserves to have you do this ,
42007005	because he loves our nation and has built our synagogue . ’
42007006	So Jesus went with them . He was not far from the house when the centurion sent friends to say to him : ‘ Lord , don’t trouble yourself , for I do not deserve to have you come under my roof .
42007007	That is why I did not even consider myself worthy to come to you . But say the word , and my servant will be healed .
42007008	For I myself am a man under authority , with soldiers under me . I tell this one , “ Go ” , and he goes ; and that one , “ Come ” , and he comes . I say to my servant , “ Do this ” , and he does it . ’
42007009	When Jesus heard this , he was amazed at him , and turning to the crowd following him , he said , ‘ I tell you , I have not found such great faith even in Israel . ’
42007010	Then the men who had been sent returned to the house and found the servant well .
42007011	Soon afterwards , Jesus went to a town called Nain , and his disciples and a large crowd went along with him .
42007012	As he approached the town gate , a dead person was being carried out – the only son of his mother , and she was a widow . And a large crowd from the town was with her .
42007013	When the Lord saw her , his heart went out to her and he said , ‘ Don’t cry . ’
42007014	Then he went up and touched the bier they were carrying him on , and the bearers stood still . He said , ‘ Young man , I say to you , get up ! ’
42007015	The dead man sat up and began to talk , and Jesus gave him back to his mother .
42007016	They were all filled with awe and praised God . ‘ A great prophet has appeared among us , ’ they said . ‘ God has come to help his people . ’
42007017	This news about Jesus spread throughout Judea and the surrounding country .
42007018	John’s disciples told him about all these things . Calling two of them ,
42007019	he sent them to the Lord to ask , ‘ Are you the one who is to come , or should we expect someone else ? ’
42007020	When the men came to Jesus , they said , ‘ John the Baptist sent us to you to ask , “ Are you the one who is to come , or should we expect someone else ? ” ’
42007021	At that very time Jesus cured many who had diseases , illnesses and evil spirits , and gave sight to many who were blind .
42007022	So he replied to the messengers , ‘ Go back and report to John what you have seen and heard : the blind receive sight , the lame walk , those who have leprosy are cleansed , the deaf hear , the dead are raised , and the good news is proclaimed to the poor .
42007023	Blessed is anyone who does not stumble on account of me . ’
42007024	After John’s messengers left , Jesus began to speak to the crowd about John : ‘ What did you go out into the wilderness to see ? A reed swayed by the wind ?
42007025	If not , what did you go out to see ? A man dressed in fine clothes ? No , those who wear expensive clothes and indulge in luxury are in palaces .
42007026	But what did you go out to see ? A prophet ? Yes , I tell you , and more than a prophet .
42007027	This is the one about whom it is written : ‘ “ I will send my messenger ahead of you , who will prepare your way before you . ”
42007028	I tell you , among those born of women there is no one greater than John ; yet the one who is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he . ’
42007029	( All the people , even the tax collectors , when they heard Jesus’ words , acknowledged that God’s way was right , because they had been baptised by John .
42007030	But the Pharisees and the experts in the law rejected God’s purpose for themselves , because they had not been baptised by John . )
42007031	Jesus went on to say , ‘ To what , then , can I compare the people of this generation ? What are they like ?
42007032	They are like children sitting in the market-place and calling out to each other : ‘ “ We played the pipe for you , and you did not dance ; we sang a dirge , and you did not cry . ”
42007036	When one of the Pharisees invited Jesus to have dinner with him , he went to the Pharisee’s house and reclined at the table .
42007037	A woman in that town who lived a sinful life learned that Jesus was eating at the Pharisee’s house , so she came there with an alabaster jar of perfume .
42007038	As she stood behind him at his feet weeping , she began to wet his feet with her tears . Then she wiped them with her hair , kissed them and poured perfume on them .
42007039	When the Pharisee who had invited him saw this , he said to himself , ‘ If this man were a prophet , he would know who is touching him and what kind of woman she is – that she is a sinner . ’
42007040	Jesus answered him , ‘ Simon , I have something to tell you . ’ ‘ Tell me , teacher , ’ he said .
42007041	‘ Two people owed money to a certain money-lender . One owed him five hundred denarii , and the other fifty .
42007042	Neither of them had the money to pay him back , so he forgave the debts of both . Now which of them will love him more ? ’
42007043	Simon replied , ‘ I suppose the one who had the bigger debt forgiven . ’ ‘ You have judged correctly , ’ Jesus said .
42007044	Then he turned towards the woman and said to Simon , ‘ Do you see this woman ? I came into your house . You did not give me any water for my feet , but she wet my feet with her tears and wiped them with her hair .
42007045	You did not give me a kiss , but this woman , from the time I entered , has not stopped kissing my feet .
42007046	You did not put oil on my head , but she has poured perfume on my feet .
42007047	Therefore , I tell you , her many sins have been forgiven – as her great love has shown . But whoever has been forgiven little loves little . ’
42007048	Then Jesus said to her , ‘ Your sins are forgiven . ’
42007049	The other guests began to say among themselves , ‘ Who is this who even forgives sins ? ’
42007050	Jesus said to the woman , ‘ Your faith has saved you ; go in peace . ’
42008001	After this , Jesus travelled about from one town and village to another , proclaiming the good news of the kingdom of God . The Twelve were with him ,
42008002	and also some women who had been cured of evil spirits and diseases : Mary ( called Magdalene ) from whom seven demons had come out ;
42008003	Joanna the wife of Chuza , the manager of Herod’s household ; Susanna ; and many others . These women were helping to support them out of their own means .
42008004	While a large crowd was gathering and people were coming to Jesus from town after town , he told this parable :
42008005	‘ A farmer went out to sow his seed . As he was scattering the seed , some fell along the path ; it was trampled on , and the birds ate it up .
42008006	Some fell on rocky ground , and when it came up , the plants withered because they had no moisture .
42008007	Other seed fell among thorns , which grew up with it and choked the plants .
42008008	Still other seed fell on good soil . It came up and yielded a crop , a hundred times more than was sown . ’ When he said this , he called out , ‘ Whoever has ears to hear , let them hear . ’
42008009	His disciples asked him what this parable meant .
42008010	He said , ‘ The knowledge of the secrets of the kingdom of God has been given to you , but to others I speak in parables , so that , ‘ “ though seeing , they may not see ; though hearing , they may not understand . ”
42008011	‘ This is the meaning of the parable : the seed is the word of God .
42008012	Those along the path are the ones who hear , and then the devil comes and takes away the word from their hearts , so that they may not believe and be saved .
42008013	Those on the rocky ground are the ones who receive the word with joy when they hear it , but they have no root . They believe for a while , but in the time of testing they fall away .
42008014	The seed that fell among thorns stands for those who hear , but as they go on their way they are choked by life’s worries , riches and pleasures , and they do not mature .
42008015	But the seed on good soil stands for those with a noble and good heart , who hear the word , retain it , and by persevering produce a crop .
42008016	‘ No one lights a lamp and hides it in a clay jar or puts it under a bed . Instead , they put it on a stand , so that those who come in can see the light .
42008017	For there is nothing hidden that will not be disclosed , and nothing concealed that will not be known or brought out into the open .
42008018	Therefore consider carefully how you listen . Whoever has will be given more ; whoever does not have , even what they think they have will be taken from them . ’
42008019	Now Jesus’ mother and brothers came to see him , but they were not able to get near him because of the crowd .
42008020	Someone told him , ‘ Your mother and brothers are standing outside , wanting to see you . ’
42008021	He replied , ‘ My mother and brothers are those who hear God’s word and put it into practice . ’
42008022	One day Jesus said to his disciples , ‘ Let us go over to the other side of the lake . ’ So they got into a boat and set out .
42008023	As they sailed , he fell asleep . A squall came down on the lake , so that the boat was being swamped , and they were in great danger .
42008024	The disciples went and woke him , saying , ‘ Master , Master , we’re going to drown ! ’ He got up and rebuked the wind and the raging waters ; the storm subsided , and all was calm .
42008025	‘ Where is your faith ? ’ he asked his disciples . In fear and amazement they asked one another , ‘ Who is this ? He commands even the winds and the water , and they obey him . ’
42008026	They sailed to the region of the Gerasenes , which is across the lake from Galilee .
42008027	When Jesus stepped ashore , he was met by a demon-possessed man from the town . For a long time this man had not worn clothes or lived in a house , but had lived in the tombs .
42008028	When he saw Jesus , he cried out and fell at his feet , shouting at the top of his voice , ‘ What do you want with me , Jesus , Son of the Most High God ? I beg you , don’t torture me ! ’
42008029	For Jesus had commanded the impure spirit to come out of the man . Many times it had seized him , and though he was chained hand and foot and kept under guard , he had broken his chains and had been driven by the demon into solitary places .
42008030	Jesus asked him , ‘ What is your name ? ’ ‘ Legion , ’ he replied , because many demons had gone into him .
42008031	And they begged Jesus repeatedly not to order them to go into the Abyss .
42008032	A large herd of pigs was feeding there on the hillside . The demons begged Jesus to let them go into the pigs , and he gave them permission .
42008033	When the demons came out of the man , they went into the pigs , and the herd rushed down the steep bank into the lake and was drowned .
42008034	When those tending the pigs saw what had happened , they ran off and reported this in the town and countryside ,
42008035	and the people went out to see what had happened . When they came to Jesus , they found the man from whom the demons had gone out , sitting at Jesus’ feet , dressed and in his right mind ; and they were afraid .
42008036	Those who had seen it told the people how the demon-possessed man had been cured .
42008037	Then all the people of the region of the Gerasenes asked Jesus to leave them , because they were overcome with fear . So he got into the boat and left .
42008038	The man from whom the demons had gone out begged to go with him , but Jesus sent him away , saying ,
42008039	‘ Return home and tell how much God has done for you . ’ So the man went away and told all over the town how much Jesus had done for him .
42008040	Now when Jesus returned , a crowd welcomed him , for they were all expecting him .
42008041	Then a man named Jairus , a synagogue leader , came and fell at Jesus’ feet , pleading with him to come to his house
42008042	because his only daughter , a girl of about twelve , was dying . As Jesus was on his way , the crowds almost crushed him .
42008043	And a woman was there who had been subject to bleeding for twelve years , but no one could heal her .
42008044	She came up behind him and touched the edge of his cloak , and immediately her bleeding stopped .
42008045	‘ Who touched me ? ’ Jesus asked . When they all denied it , Peter said , ‘ Master , the people are crowding and pressing against you . ’
42008046	But Jesus said , ‘ Someone touched me ; I know that power has gone out from me . ’
42008047	Then the woman , seeing that she could not go unnoticed , came trembling and fell at his feet . In the presence of all the people , she told why she had touched him and how she had been instantly healed .
42008048	Then he said to her , ‘ Daughter , your faith has healed you . Go in peace . ’
42008049	While Jesus was still speaking , someone came from the house of Jairus , the synagogue leader . ‘ Your daughter is dead , ’ he said . ‘ Don’t bother the teacher anymore . ’
42008050	Hearing this , Jesus said to Jairus , ‘ Don’t be afraid ; just believe , and she will be healed . ’
42008051	When he arrived at the house of Jairus , he did not let anyone go in with him except Peter , John and James , and the child’s father and mother .
42008052	Meanwhile , all the people were wailing and mourning for her . ‘ Stop wailing , ’ Jesus said . ‘ She is not dead but asleep . ’
42008053	They laughed at him , knowing that she was dead .
42008054	But he took her by the hand and said , ‘ My child , get up ! ’
42008055	Her spirit returned , and at once she stood up . Then Jesus told them to give her something to eat .
42008056	Her parents were astonished , but he ordered them not to tell anyone what had happened .
42009001	When Jesus had called the Twelve together , he gave them power and authority to drive out all demons and to cure diseases ,
42009002	and he sent them out to proclaim the kingdom of God and to heal those who were ill .
42009003	He told them : ‘ Take nothing for the journey – no staff , no bag , no bread , no money , no extra shirt .
42009004	Whatever house you enter , stay there until you leave that town .
42009005	If people do not welcome you , leave their town and shake the dust off your feet as a testimony against them . ’
42009006	So they set out and went from village to village , proclaiming the good news and healing people everywhere .
42009007	Now Herod the tetrarch heard about all that was going on . And he was perplexed because some were saying that John had been raised from the dead ,
42009008	others that Elijah had appeared , and still others that one of the prophets of long ago had come back to life .
42009009	But Herod said , ‘ I beheaded John . Who , then , is this I hear such things about ? ’ And he tried to see him .
42009010	When the apostles returned , they reported to Jesus what they had done . Then he took them with him and they withdrew by themselves to a town called Bethsaida ,
42009011	but the crowds learned about it and followed him . He welcomed them and spoke to them about the kingdom of God , and healed those who needed healing .
42009012	Late in the afternoon the Twelve came to him and said , ‘ Send the crowd away so they can go to the surrounding villages and countryside and find food and lodging , because we are in a remote place here . ’
42009013	He replied , ‘ You give them something to eat . ’ They answered , ‘ We have only five loaves of bread and two fish – unless we go and buy food for all this crowd . ’
42009014	( About five thousand men were there . ) But he said to his disciples , ‘ Make them sit down in groups of about fifty each . ’
42009015	The disciples did so , and everyone sat down .
42009016	Taking the five loaves and the two fish and looking up to heaven , he gave thanks and broke them . Then he gave them to the disciples to distribute to the people .
42009017	They all ate and were satisfied , and the disciples picked up twelve basketfuls of broken pieces that were left over .
42009018	Once when Jesus was praying in private and his disciples were with him , he asked them , ‘ Who do the crowds say I am ? ’
42009019	They replied , ‘ Some say John the Baptist ; others say Elijah ; and still others , that one of the prophets of long ago has come back to life . ’
42009020	‘ But what about you ? ’ he asked . ‘ Who do you say I am ? ’ Peter answered , ‘ God’s Messiah . ’
42009021	Jesus strictly warned them not to tell this to anyone .
42009022	And he said , ‘ The Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders , the chief priests and the teachers of the law , and he must be killed and on the third day be raised to life . ’
42009023	Then he said to them all : ‘ Whoever wants to be my disciple must deny themselves and take up their cross daily and follow me .
42009024	For whoever wants to save their life will lose it , but whoever loses their life for me will save it .
42009025	What good is it for someone to gain the whole world , and yet lose or forfeit their very self ?
42009026	Whoever is ashamed of me and my words , the Son of Man will be ashamed of them when he comes in his glory and in the glory of the Father and of the holy angels .
42009027	‘ Truly I tell you , some who are standing here will not taste death before they see the kingdom of God . ’
42009028	About eight days after Jesus said this , he took Peter , John and James with him and went up onto a mountain to pray .
42009029	As he was praying , the appearance of his face changed , and his clothes became as bright as a flash of lightning .
42009030	Two men , Moses and Elijah , appeared in glorious splendour , talking with Jesus .
42009031	They spoke about his departure , which he was about to bring to fulfilment at Jerusalem .
42009032	Peter and his companions were very sleepy , but when they became fully awake , they saw his glory and the two men standing with him .
42009033	As the men were leaving Jesus , Peter said to him , ‘ Master , it is good for us to be here . Let us put up three shelters – one for you , one for Moses and one for Elijah . ’ ( He did not know what he was saying . )
42009034	While he was speaking , a cloud appeared and covered them , and they were afraid as they entered the cloud .
42009035	A voice came from the cloud , saying , ‘ This is my Son , whom I have chosen ; listen to him . ’
42009036	When the voice had spoken , they found that Jesus was alone . The disciples kept this to themselves and did not tell anyone at that time what they had seen .
42009037	The next day , when they came down from the mountain , a large crowd met him .
42009038	A man in the crowd called out , ‘ Teacher , I beg you to look at my son , for he is my only child .
42009039	A spirit seizes him and he suddenly screams ; it throws him into convulsions so that he foams at the mouth . It scarcely ever leaves him and is destroying him .
42009040	I begged your disciples to drive it out , but they could not . ’
42009041	‘ You unbelieving and perverse generation , ’ Jesus replied , ‘ how long shall I stay with you and put up with you ? Bring your son here . ’
42009042	Even while the boy was coming , the demon threw him to the ground in a convulsion . But Jesus rebuked the impure spirit , healed the boy and gave him back to his father .
42009043	And they were all amazed at the greatness of God . While everyone was marvelling at all that Jesus did , he said to his disciples ,
42009044	‘ Listen carefully to what I am about to tell you : the Son of Man is going to be delivered into the hands of men . ’
42009045	But they did not understand what this meant . It was hidden from them , so that they did not grasp it , and they were afraid to ask him about it .
42009046	An argument started among the disciples as to which of them would be the greatest .
42009047	Jesus , knowing their thoughts , took a little child and made him stand beside him .
42009048	Then he said to them , ‘ Whoever welcomes this little child in my name welcomes me ; and whoever welcomes me welcomes the one who sent me . For it is the one who is least among you all who is the greatest . ’
42009049	‘ Master , ’ said John , ‘ we saw someone driving out demons in your name and we tried to stop him , because he is not one of us . ’
42009050	‘ Do not stop him , ’ Jesus said , ‘ for whoever is not against you is for you . ’
42009051	As the time approached for him to be taken up to heaven , Jesus resolutely set out for Jerusalem .
42009052	And he sent messengers on ahead , who went into a Samaritan village to get things ready for him ;
42009053	but the people there did not welcome him , because he was heading for Jerusalem .
42009054	When the disciples James and John saw this , they asked , ‘ Lord , do you want us to call fire down from heaven to destroy them ? ’
42009055	But Jesus turned and rebuked them .
42009056	Then he and his disciples went to another village .
42009057	As they were walking along the road , a man said to him , ‘ I will follow you wherever you go . ’
42009058	Jesus replied , ‘ Foxes have dens and birds have nests , but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay his head . ’
42009059	He said to another man , ‘ Follow me . ’ But he replied , ‘ Lord , first let me go and bury my father . ’
42009060	Jesus said to him , ‘ Let the dead bury their own dead , but you go and proclaim the kingdom of God . ’
42009061	Still another said , ‘ I will follow you , Lord ; but first let me go back and say goodbye to my family . ’
42009062	Jesus replied , ‘ No one who puts a hand to the plough and looks back is fit for service in the kingdom of God . ’
42010001	After this the Lord appointed seventy-two others and sent them two by two ahead of him to every town and place where he was about to go .
42010002	He told them , ‘ The harvest is plentiful , but the workers are few . Ask the Lord of the harvest , therefore , to send out workers into his harvest field .
42010003	Go ! I am sending you out like lambs among wolves .
42010004	Do not take a purse or bag or sandals ; and do not greet anyone on the road .
42010005	‘ When you enter a house , first say , “ Peace to this house . ”
42010006	If someone who promotes peace is there , your peace will rest on them ; if not , it will return to you .
42010007	Stay there , eating and drinking whatever they give you , for the worker deserves his wages . Do not move around from house to house .
42010008	‘ When you enter a town and are welcomed , eat what is offered to you .
42010009	Heal those there who are ill and tell them , “ The kingdom of God has come near to you . ”
42010010	But when you enter a town and are not welcomed , go into its streets and say ,
42010011	“ Even the dust of your town we wipe from our feet as a warning to you . Yet be sure of this : the kingdom of God has come near . ”
42010012	I tell you , it will be more bearable on that day for Sodom than for that town .
42010013	‘ Woe to you , Chorazin ! Woe to you , Bethsaida ! For if the miracles that were performed in you had been performed in Tyre and Sidon , they would have repented long ago , sitting in sackcloth and ashes .
42010014	But it will be more bearable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment than for you .
42010015	And you , Capernaum , will you be lifted to the heavens ? No , you will go down to Hades .
42010016	‘ Whoever listens to you listens to me ; whoever rejects you rejects me ; but whoever rejects me rejects him who sent me . ’
42010017	The seventy-two returned with joy and said , ‘ Lord , even the demons submit to us in your name . ’
42010018	He replied , ‘ I saw Satan fall like lightning from heaven .
42010019	I have given you authority to trample on snakes and scorpions and to overcome all the power of the enemy ; nothing will harm you .
42010020	However , do not rejoice that the spirits submit to you , but rejoice that your names are written in heaven . ’
42010021	At that time Jesus , full of joy through the Holy Spirit , said , ‘ I praise you , Father , Lord of heaven and earth , because you have hidden these things from the wise and learned , and revealed them to little children . Yes , Father , for this is what you were pleased to do .
42010022	‘ All things have been committed to me by my Father . No one knows who the Son is except the Father , and no one knows who the Father is except the Son and those to whom the Son chooses to reveal him . ’
42010023	Then he turned to his disciples and said privately , ‘ Blessed are the eyes that see what you see .
42010024	For I tell you that many prophets and kings wanted to see what you see but did not see it , and to hear what you hear but did not hear it . ’
42010025	On one occasion an expert in the law stood up to test Jesus . ‘ Teacher , ’ he asked , ‘ what must I do to inherit eternal life ? ’
42010026	‘ What is written in the Law ? ’ he replied . ‘ How do you read it ? ’
42010027	He answered , ‘ “ Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength and with all your mind ” ; and , “ Love your neighbour as yourself . ” ’
42010028	‘ You have answered correctly , ’ Jesus replied . ‘ Do this and you will live . ’
42010029	But he wanted to justify himself , so he asked Jesus , ‘ And who is my neighbour ? ’
42010030	In reply Jesus said : ‘ A man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho , when he was attacked by robbers . They stripped him of his clothes , beat him and went away , leaving him half-dead .
42010031	A priest happened to be going down the same road , and when he saw the man , he passed by on the other side .
42010032	So too , a Levite , when he came to the place and saw him , passed by on the other side .
42010033	But a Samaritan , as he travelled , came where the man was ; and when he saw him , he took pity on him .
42010034	He went to him and bandaged his wounds , pouring on oil and wine . Then he put the man on his own donkey , brought him to an inn and took care of him .
42010035	The next day he took out two denarii and gave them to the innkeeper . “ Look after him , ” he said , “ and when I return , I will reimburse you for any extra expense you may have . ”
42010036	‘ Which of these three do you think was a neighbour to the man who fell into the hands of robbers ? ’
42010037	The expert in the law replied , ‘ The one who had mercy on him . ’ Jesus told him , ‘ Go and do likewise . ’
42010038	As Jesus and his disciples were on their way , he came to a village where a woman named Martha opened her home to him .
42010039	She had a sister called Mary , who sat at the Lord’s feet listening to what he said .
42010040	But Martha was distracted by all the preparations that had to be made . She came to him and asked , ‘ Lord , don’t you care that my sister has left me to do the work by myself ? Tell her to help me ! ’
42010041	‘ Martha , Martha , ’ the Lord answered , ‘ you are worried and upset about many things ,
42010042	but few things are needed – or indeed only one . Mary has chosen what is better , and it will not be taken away from her . ’
42011001	One day Jesus was praying in a certain place . When he finished , one of his disciples said to him , ‘ Lord , teach us to pray , just as John taught his disciples . ’
42011002	He said to them , ‘ When you pray , say : ‘ “ Father , hallowed be your name , your kingdom come .
42011003	Give us each day our daily bread .
42011004	Forgive us our sins , for we also forgive everyone who sins against us . And lead us not into temptation . ” ’
42011005	Then Jesus said to them , ‘ Suppose you have a friend , and you go to him at midnight and say , “ Friend , lend me three loaves of bread ;
42011006	a friend of mine on a journey has come to me , and I have no food to offer him . ”
42011007	And suppose the one inside answers , “ Don’t bother me . The door is already locked , and my children and I are in bed . I can’t get up and give you anything . ”
42011008	I tell you , even though he will not get up and give you the bread because of friendship , yet because of your shameless audacity he will surely get up and give you as much as you need .
42011009	‘ So I say to you : ask and it will be given to you ; seek and you will find ; knock and the door will be opened to you .
42011010	For everyone who asks receives ; the one who seeks finds ; and to the one who knocks , the door will be opened .
42011011	‘ Which of you fathers , if your son asks for a fish , will give him a snake instead ?
42011012	Or if he asks for an egg , will give him a scorpion ?
42011013	If you then , though you are evil , know how to give good gifts to your children , how much more will your Father in heaven give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him ! ’
42011014	Jesus was driving out a demon that was mute . When the demon left , the man who had been mute spoke , and the crowd was amazed .
42011015	But some of them said , ‘ By Beelzebul , the prince of demons , he is driving out demons . ’
42011016	Others tested him by asking for a sign from heaven .
42011017	Jesus knew their thoughts and said to them : ‘ Any kingdom divided against itself will be ruined , and a house divided against itself will fall .
42011018	If Satan is divided against himself , how can his kingdom stand ? I say this because you claim that I drive out demons by Beelzebul .
42011019	Now if I drive out demons by Beelzebul , by whom do your followers drive them out ? So then , they will be your judges .
42011020	But if I drive out demons by the finger of God , then the kingdom of God has come upon you .
42011021	‘ When a strong man , fully armed , guards his own house , his possessions are safe .
42011022	But when someone stronger attacks and overpowers him , he takes away the armour in which the man trusted and divides up his plunder .
42011023	‘ Whoever is not with me is against me , and whoever does not gather with me scatters .
42011024	‘ When an impure spirit comes out of a person , it goes through arid places seeking rest and does not find it . Then it says , “ I will return to the house I left . ”
42011025	When it arrives , it finds the house swept clean and put in order .
42011026	Then it goes and takes seven other spirits more wicked than itself , and they go in and live there . And the final condition of that person is worse than the first . ’
42011027	As Jesus was saying these things , a woman in the crowd called out , ‘ Blessed is the mother who gave you birth and nursed you . ’
42011028	He replied , ‘ Blessed rather are those who hear the word of God and obey it . ’
42011029	As the crowds increased , Jesus said , ‘ This is a wicked generation . It asks for a sign , but none will be given it except the sign of Jonah .
42011030	For as Jonah was a sign to the Ninevites , so also will the Son of Man be to this generation .
42011031	The Queen of the South will rise at the judgment with the people of this generation and condemn them , for she came from the ends of the earth to listen to Solomon’s wisdom ; and now something greater than Solomon is here .
42011032	The men of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it , for they repented at the preaching of Jonah ; and now something greater than Jonah is here .
42011033	‘ No one lights a lamp and puts it in a place where it will be hidden , or under a bowl . Instead they put it on its stand , so that those who come in may see the light .
42011034	Your eye is the lamp of your body . When your eyes are healthy , your whole body also is full of light . But when they are unhealthy , your body also is full of darkness .
42011035	See to it , then , that the light within you is not darkness .
42011036	Therefore , if your whole body is full of light , and no part of it dark , it will be just as full of light as when a lamp shines its light on you . ’
42011037	When Jesus had finished speaking , a Pharisee invited him to eat with him ; so he went in and reclined at the table .
42011038	But the Pharisee was surprised when he noticed that Jesus did not first wash before the meal .
42011039	Then the Lord said to him , ‘ Now then , you Pharisees clean the outside of the cup and dish , but inside you are full of greed and wickedness .
42011040	You foolish people ! Did not the one who made the outside make the inside also ?
42011041	But now as for what is inside you – be generous to the poor , and everything will be clean for you .
42011042	‘ Woe to you Pharisees , because you give God a tenth of your mint , rue and all other kinds of garden herbs , but you neglect justice and the love of God . You should have practised the latter without leaving the former undone .
42011043	‘ Woe to you Pharisees , because you love the most important seats in the synagogues and respectful greetings in the market-places .
42011044	‘ Woe to you , because you are like unmarked graves , which people walk over without knowing it . ’
42011045	One of the experts in the law answered him , ‘ Teacher , when you say these things , you insult us also . ’
42011046	Jesus replied , ‘ And you experts in the law , woe to you , because you load people down with burdens they can hardly carry , and you yourselves will not lift one finger to help them .
42011047	‘ Woe to you , because you build tombs for the prophets , and it was your ancestors who killed them .
42011048	So you testify that you approve of what your ancestors did ; they killed the prophets , and you build their tombs .
42011049	Because of this , God in his wisdom said , “ I will send them prophets and apostles , some of whom they will kill and others they will persecute . ”
42011050	Therefore this generation will be held responsible for the blood of all the prophets that has been shed since the beginning of the world ,
42011051	from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah , who was killed between the altar and the sanctuary . Yes , I tell you , this generation will be held responsible for it all .
42011052	‘ Woe to you experts in the law , because you have taken away the key to knowledge . You yourselves have not entered , and you have hindered those who were entering . ’
42011053	When Jesus went outside , the Pharisees and the teachers of the law began to oppose him fiercely and to besiege him with questions ,
42011054	waiting to catch him in something he might say .
42012001	Meanwhile , when a crowd of many thousands had gathered , so that they were trampling on one another , Jesus began to speak first to his disciples , saying : ‘ Be on your guard against the yeast of the Pharisees , which is hypocrisy .
42012002	There is nothing concealed that will not be disclosed , or hidden that will not be made known .
42012003	What you have said in the dark will be heard in the daylight , and what you have whispered in the ear in the inner rooms will be proclaimed from the roofs .
42012004	‘ I tell you , my friends , do not be afraid of those who kill the body and after that can do no more .
42012005	But I will show you whom you should fear : fear him who , after your body has been killed , has authority to throw you into hell . Yes , I tell you , fear him .
42012006	Are not five sparrows sold for two pennies ? Yet not one of them is forgotten by God .
42012007	Indeed , the very hairs of your head are all numbered . Don’t be afraid ; you are worth more than many sparrows .
42012008	‘ I tell you , whoever publicly acknowledges me before others , the Son of Man will also acknowledge before the angels of God .
42012009	But whoever disowns me before others will be disowned before the angels of God .
42012010	And everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven , but anyone who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven .
42012011	‘ When you are brought before synagogues , rulers and authorities , do not worry about how you will defend yourselves or what you will say ,
42012012	for the Holy Spirit will teach you at that time what you should say . ’
42012013	Someone in the crowd said to him , ‘ Teacher , tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me . ’
42012014	Jesus replied , ‘ Man , who appointed me a judge or an arbiter between you ? ’
42012015	Then he said to them , ‘ Watch out ! Be on your guard against all kinds of greed ; life does not consist in an abundance of possessions . ’

42012017	He thought to himself , “ What shall I do ? I have no place to store my crops . ”
42012018	‘ Then he said , “ This is what I’ll do . I will tear down my barns and build bigger ones , and there I will store my surplus grain .
42012019	And I’ll say to myself , ‘ You have plenty of grain laid up for many years . Take life easy ; eat , drink and be merry . ’ ”
42012020	‘ But God said to him , “ You fool ! This very night your life will be demanded from you . Then who will get what you have prepared for yourself ? ”
42012021	‘ This is how it will be with whoever stores up things for themselves but is not rich towards God . ’
42012022	Then Jesus said to his disciples : ‘ Therefore I tell you , do not worry about your life , what you will eat ; or about your body , what you will wear .
42012023	For life is more than food , and the body more than clothes .
42012024	Consider the ravens : they do not sow or reap , they have no storeroom or barn ; yet God feeds them . And how much more valuable you are than birds !
42012025	Who of you by worrying can add a single hour to your life ?
42012026	Since you cannot do this very little thing , why do you worry about the rest ?
42012027	‘ Consider how the wild flowers grow . They do not labour or spin . Yet I tell you , not even Solomon in all his splendour was dressed like one of these .
42012028	If that is how God clothes the grass of the field , which is here today , and tomorrow is thrown into the fire , how much more will he clothe you – you of little faith !
42012029	And do not set your heart on what you will eat or drink ; do not worry about it .
42012030	For the pagan world runs after all such things , and your Father knows that you need them .
42012031	But seek his kingdom , and these things will be given to you as well .
42012032	‘ Do not be afraid , little flock , for your Father has been pleased to give you the kingdom .
42012033	Sell your possessions and give to the poor . Provide purses for yourselves that will not wear out , a treasure in heaven that will never fail , where no thief comes near and no moth destroys .
42012034	For where your treasure is , there your heart will be also .
42012035	‘ Be dressed ready for service and keep your lamps burning ,
42012036	like servants waiting for their master to return from a wedding banquet , so that when he comes and knocks they can immediately open the door for him .
42012037	It will be good for those servants whose master finds them watching when he comes . Truly I tell you , he will dress himself to serve , will make them recline at the table and will come and wait on them .
42012038	It will be good for those servants whose master finds them ready , even if he comes in the middle of the night or towards daybreak .
42012039	But understand this : if the owner of the house had known at what hour the thief was coming , he would not have let his house be broken into .
42012040	You also must be ready , because the Son of Man will come at an hour when you do not expect him . ’
42012041	Peter asked , ‘ Lord , are you telling this parable to us , or to everyone ? ’
42012042	The Lord answered , ‘ Who then is the faithful and wise manager , whom the master puts in charge of his servants to give them their food allowance at the proper time ?
42012043	It will be good for that servant whom the master finds doing so when he returns .
42012044	Truly I tell you , he will put him in charge of all his possessions .
42012045	But suppose the servant says to himself , “ My master is taking a long time in coming , ” and he then begins to beat the other servants , both men and women , and to eat and drink and get drunk .
42012046	The master of that servant will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he is not aware of . He will cut him to pieces and assign him a place with the unbelievers .
42012047	‘ The servant who knows the master’s will and does not get ready or does not do what the master wants will be beaten with many blows .
42012048	But the one who does not know and does things deserving punishment will be beaten with few blows . From everyone who has been given much , much will be demanded ; and from the one who has been entrusted with much , much more will be asked .
42012049	‘ I have come to bring fire on the earth , and how I wish it were already kindled !
42012050	But I have a baptism to undergo , and what constraint I am under until it is completed !
42012051	Do you think I came to bring peace on earth ? No , I tell you , but division .
42012052	From now on there will be five in one family divided against each other , three against two and two against three .
42012053	They will be divided , father against son and son against father , mother against daughter and daughter against mother , mother-in-law against daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against mother-in-law . ’
42012054	He said to the crowd : ‘ When you see a cloud rising in the west , immediately you say , “ It’s going to rain , ” and it does .
42012055	And when the south wind blows , you say , “ It’s going to be hot , ” and it is .
42012056	Hypocrites ! You know how to interpret the appearance of the earth and the sky . How is it that you don’t know how to interpret this present time ?
42012057	‘ Why don’t you judge for yourselves what is right ?
42012058	As you are going with your adversary to the magistrate , try hard to be reconciled on the way , or your adversary may drag you off to the judge , and the judge turn you over to the officer , and the officer throw you into prison .
42012059	I tell you , you will not get out until you have paid the last penny . ’
42013001	Now there were some present at that time who told Jesus about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices .
42013002	Jesus answered , ‘ Do you think that these Galileans were worse sinners than all the other Galileans because they suffered this way ?
42013003	I tell you , no ! But unless you repent , you too will all perish .
42013004	Or those eighteen who died when the tower in Siloam fell on them – do you think they were more guilty than all the others living in Jerusalem ?
42013005	I tell you , no ! But unless you repent , you too will all perish . ’
42013006	Then he told this parable : ‘ A man had a fig-tree growing in his vineyard , and he went to look for fruit on it but did not find any .
42013007	So he said to the man who took care of the vineyard , “ For three years now I’ve been coming to look for fruit on this fig-tree and haven’t found any . Cut it down ! Why should it use up the soil ? ”
42013008	‘ “ Sir , ” the man replied , “ leave it alone for one more year , and I’ll dig round it and fertilise it .
42013009	If it bears fruit next year , fine ! If not , then cut it down . ” ’
42013010	On a Sabbath Jesus was teaching in one of the synagogues ,
42013011	and a woman was there who had been crippled by a spirit for eighteen years . She was bent over and could not straighten up at all .
42013012	When Jesus saw her , he called her forward and said to her , ‘ Woman , you are set free from your infirmity . ’
42013013	Then he put his hands on her , and immediately she straightened up and praised God .
42013014	Indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath , the synagogue leader said to the people , ‘ There are six days for work . So come and be healed on those days , not on the Sabbath . ’
42013015	The Lord answered him , ‘ You hypocrites ! Doesn’t each of you on the Sabbath untie your ox or donkey from the stall and lead it out to give it water ?
42013016	Then should not this woman , a daughter of Abraham , whom Satan has kept bound for eighteen long years , be set free on the Sabbath day from what bound her ? ’
42013017	When he said this , all his opponents were humiliated , but the people were delighted with all the wonderful things he was doing .
42013018	Then Jesus asked , ‘ What is the kingdom of God like ? What shall I compare it to ?
42013019	It is like a mustard seed , which a man took and planted in his garden . It grew and became a tree , and the birds perched in its branches . ’
42013020	Again he asked , ‘ What shall I compare the kingdom of God to ?
42013021	It is like yeast that a woman took and mixed into about thirty kilograms of flour until it worked all through the dough . ’
42013022	Then Jesus went through the towns and villages , teaching as he made his way to Jerusalem .
42013023	Someone asked him , ‘ Lord , are only a few people going to be saved ? ’ He said to them ,
42013024	‘ Make every effort to enter through the narrow door , because many , I tell you , will try to enter and will not be able to .
42013025	Once the owner of the house gets up and closes the door , you will stand outside knocking and pleading , “ Sir , open the door for us . ” ‘ But he will answer , “ I don’t know you or where you come from . ”
42013026	‘ Then you will say , “ We ate and drank with you , and you taught in our streets . ”
42013027	‘ But he will reply , “ I don’t know you or where you come from . Away from me , all you evildoers ! ”
42013028	‘ There will be weeping there , and gnashing of teeth , when you see Abraham , Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets in the kingdom of God , but you yourselves thrown out .
42013029	People will come from east and west and north and south , and will take their places at the feast in the kingdom of God .
42013030	Indeed there are those who are last who will be first , and first who will be last . ’
42013031	At that time some Pharisees came to Jesus and said to him , ‘ Leave this place and go somewhere else . Herod wants to kill you . ’
42013032	He replied , ‘ Go and tell that fox , “ I will keep on driving out demons and healing people today and tomorrow , and on the third day I will reach my goal . ”
42013033	In any case , I must press on today and tomorrow and the next day – for surely no prophet can die outside Jerusalem !
42013034	‘ Jerusalem , Jerusalem , you who kill the prophets and stone those sent to you , how often I have longed to gather your children together , as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings , and you were not willing .
