44008019	and said , ‘ Give me also this ability so that everyone on whom I lay my hands may receive the Holy Spirit . ’
44008020	Peter answered : ‘ May your money perish with you , because you thought you could buy the gift of God with money !
44008021	You have no part or share in this ministry , because your heart is not right before God .
44008022	Repent of this wickedness and pray to the Lord in the hope that he may forgive you for having such a thought in your heart .
44008023	For I see that you are full of bitterness and captive to sin . ’
44008024	Then Simon answered , ‘ Pray to the Lord for me so that nothing you have said may happen to me . ’
44008025	After they had further proclaimed the word of the Lord and testified about Jesus , Peter and John returned to Jerusalem , preaching the gospel in many Samaritan villages .
44008026	Now an angel of the Lord said to Philip , ‘ Go south to the road – the desert road – that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza . ’
44008027	So he started out , and on his way he met an Ethiopian eunuch , an important official in charge of all the treasury of the Kandake ( which means ‘ queen of the Ethiopians’ ) . This man had gone to Jerusalem to worship ,
44008028	and on his way home was sitting in his chariot reading the Book of Isaiah the prophet .
44008029	The Spirit told Philip , ‘ Go to that chariot and stay near it . ’
44008030	Then Philip ran up to the chariot and heard the man reading Isaiah the prophet . ‘ Do you understand what you are reading ? ’ Philip asked .
44008031	‘ How can I , ’ he said , ‘ unless someone explains it to me ? ’ So he invited Philip to come up and sit with him .
44008032	This is the passage of Scripture the eunuch was reading : ‘ He was led like a sheep to the slaughter , and as a lamb before its shearer is silent , so he did not open his mouth .
44008033	In his humiliation he was deprived of justice . Who can speak of his descendants ? For his life was taken from the earth . ’
44008034	The eunuch asked Philip , ‘ Tell me , please , who is the prophet talking about , himself or someone else ? ’
44008035	Then Philip began with that very passage of Scripture and told him the good news about Jesus .
44008036	As they travelled along the road , they came to some water and the eunuch said , ‘ Look , here is water . What can stand in the way of my being baptised ? ’ [
44008038	And he gave orders to stop the chariot . Then both Philip and the eunuch went down into the water and Philip baptised him .
44008039	When they came up out of the water , the Spirit of the Lord suddenly took Philip away , and the eunuch did not see him again , but went on his way rejoicing .
44008040	Philip , however , appeared at Azotus and travelled about , preaching the gospel in all the towns until he reached Caesarea .
44009001	Meanwhile , Saul was still breathing out murderous threats against the Lord’s disciples . He went to the high priest
44009002	and asked him for letters to the synagogues in Damascus , so that if he found any there who belonged to the Way , whether men or women , he might take them as prisoners to Jerusalem .
44009003	As he neared Damascus on his journey , suddenly a light from heaven flashed around him .
44009004	He fell to the ground and heard a voice say to him , ‘ Saul , Saul , why do you persecute me ? ’
44009005	‘ Who are you , Lord ? ’ Saul asked . ‘ I am Jesus , whom you are persecuting , ’ he replied .
44009006	‘ Now get up and go into the city , and you will be told what you must do . ’
44009007	The men travelling with Saul stood there speechless ; they heard the sound but did not see anyone .
44009008	Saul got up from the ground , but when he opened his eyes he could see nothing . So they led him by the hand into Damascus .
44009009	For three days he was blind , and did not eat or drink anything .
44009010	In Damascus there was a disciple named Ananias . The Lord called to him in a vision , ‘ Ananias ! ’ ‘ Yes , Lord , ’ he answered .
44009011	The Lord told him , ‘ Go to the house of Judas on Straight Street and ask for a man from Tarsus named Saul , for he is praying .
44009012	In a vision he has seen a man named Ananias come and place his hands on him to restore his sight . ’
44009013	‘ Lord , ’ Ananias answered , ‘ I have heard many reports about this man and all the harm he has done to your holy people in Jerusalem .
44009014	And he has come here with authority from the chief priests to arrest all who call on your name . ’
44009015	But the Lord said to Ananias , ‘ Go ! This man is my chosen instrument to proclaim my name to the Gentiles and their kings and to the people of Israel .
44009016	I will show him how much he must suffer for my name . ’
44009017	Then Ananias went to the house and entered it . Placing his hands on Saul , he said , ‘ Brother Saul , the Lord – Jesus , who appeared to you on the road as you were coming here – has sent me so that you may see again and be filled with the Holy Spirit . ’
44009018	Immediately , something like scales fell from Saul’s eyes , and he could see again . He got up and was baptised ,
44009019	and after taking some food , he regained his strength . Saul spent several days with the disciples in Damascus .
44009020	At once he began to preach in the synagogues that Jesus is the Son of God .
44009021	All those who heard him were astonished and asked , ‘ Isn’t he the man who caused havoc in Jerusalem among those who call on this name ? And hasn’t he come here to take them as prisoners to the chief priests ? ’
44009022	Yet Saul grew more and more powerful and baffled the Jews living in Damascus by proving that Jesus is the Messiah .
44009023	After many days had gone by , there was a conspiracy among the Jews to kill him ,
44009024	but Saul learned of their plan . Day and night they kept close watch on the city gates in order to kill him .
44009025	But his followers took him by night and lowered him in a basket through an opening in the wall .
44009026	When he came to Jerusalem , he tried to join the disciples , but they were all afraid of him , not believing that he really was a disciple .
44009027	But Barnabas took him and brought him to the apostles . He told them how Saul on his journey had seen the Lord and that the Lord had spoken to him , and how in Damascus he had preached fearlessly in the name of Jesus .
44009028	So Saul stayed with them and moved about freely in Jerusalem , speaking boldly in the name of the Lord .
44009029	He talked and debated with the Hellenistic Jews , but they tried to kill him .
44009030	When the believers learned of this , they took him down to Caesarea and sent him off to Tarsus .
44009031	Then the church throughout Judea , Galilee and Samaria enjoyed a time of peace and was strengthened . Living in the fear of the Lord and encouraged by the Holy Spirit , it increased in numbers .
44009032	As Peter travelled about the country , he went to visit the Lord’s people who lived in Lydda .
44009033	There he found a man named Aeneas , who was paralysed and had been bedridden for eight years .
44009034	‘ Aeneas , ’ Peter said to him , ‘ Jesus Christ heals you . Get up and roll up your mat . ’ Immediately Aeneas got up .
44009035	All those who lived in Lydda and Sharon saw him and turned to the Lord .
44009036	In Joppa there was a disciple named Tabitha ( in Greek her name is Dorcas ) ; she was always doing good and helping the poor .
44009037	About that time she became ill and died , and her body was washed and placed in an upstairs room .
44009038	Lydda was near Joppa ; so when the disciples heard that Peter was in Lydda , they sent two men to him and urged him , ‘ Please come at once ! ’
44009039	Peter went with them , and when he arrived he was taken upstairs to the room . All the widows stood round him , crying and showing him the robes and other clothing that Dorcas had made while she was still with them .
44009040	Peter sent them all out of the room ; then he got down on his knees and prayed . Turning towards the dead woman , he said , ‘ Tabitha , get up . ’ She opened her eyes , and seeing Peter she sat up .
44009041	He took her by the hand and helped her to her feet . Then he called for the believers , especially the widows , and presented her to them alive .
44009042	This became known all over Joppa , and many people believed in the Lord .
44009043	Peter stayed in Joppa for some time with a tanner named Simon .
44010001	At Caesarea there was a man named Cornelius , a centurion in what was known as the Italian Regiment .
44010002	He and all his family were devout and God-fearing ; he gave generously to those in need and prayed to God regularly .
44010003	One day at about three in the afternoon he had a vision . He distinctly saw an angel of God , who came to him and said , ‘ Cornelius ! ’
44010004	Cornelius stared at him in fear . ‘ What is it , Lord ? ’ he asked . The angel answered , ‘ Your prayers and gifts to the poor have come up as a memorial offering before God .
44010005	Now send men to Joppa to bring back a man named Simon who is called Peter .
44010006	He is staying with Simon the tanner , whose house is by the sea . ’
44010007	When the angel who spoke to him had gone , Cornelius called two of his servants and a devout soldier who was one of his attendants .
44010008	He told them everything that had happened and sent them to Joppa .
44010009	About noon the following day as they were on their journey and approaching the city , Peter went up on the roof to pray .
44010010	He became hungry and wanted something to eat , and while the meal was being prepared , he fell into a trance .
44010011	He saw heaven opened and something like a large sheet being let down to earth by its four corners .
44010012	It contained all kinds of four-footed animals , as well as reptiles and birds .
44010013	Then a voice told him , ‘ Get up , Peter . Kill and eat . ’
44010014	‘ Surely not , Lord ! ’ Peter replied . ‘ I have never eaten anything impure or unclean . ’
44010015	The voice spoke to him a second time , ‘ Do not call anything impure that God has made clean . ’
44010016	This happened three times , and immediately the sheet was taken back to heaven .
44010017	While Peter was wondering about the meaning of the vision , the men sent by Cornelius found out where Simon’s house was and stopped at the gate .
44010018	They called out , asking if Simon who was known as Peter was staying there .
44010019	While Peter was still thinking about the vision , the Spirit said to him , ‘ Simon , three men are looking for you .
44010020	So get up and go downstairs . Do not hesitate to go with them , for I have sent them . ’
44010021	Peter went down and said to the men , ‘ I’m the one you’re looking for . Why have you come ? ’
44010022	The men replied , ‘ We have come from Cornelius the centurion . He is a righteous and God-fearing man , who is respected by all the Jewish people . A holy angel told him to ask you to come to his house so that he could hear what you have to say . ’
44010023	Then Peter invited the men into the house to be his guests . The next day Peter started out with them , and some of the believers from Joppa went along .
44010024	The following day he arrived in Caesarea . Cornelius was expecting them and had called together his relatives and close friends .
44010025	As Peter entered the house , Cornelius met him and fell at his feet in reverence .
44010026	But Peter made him get up . ‘ Stand up , ’ he said , ‘ I am only a man myself . ’
44010027	While talking with him , Peter went inside and found a large gathering of people .
44010028	He said to them : ‘ You are well aware that it is against our law for a Jew to associate with or visit a Gentile . But God has shown me that I should not call anyone impure or unclean .
44010029	So when I was sent for , I came without raising any objection . May I ask why you sent for me ? ’
44010030	Cornelius answered : ‘ Three days ago I was in my house praying at this hour , at three in the afternoon . Suddenly a man in shining clothes stood before me
44010031	and said , “ Cornelius , God has heard your prayer and remembered your gifts to the poor .
44010032	Send to Joppa for Simon who is called Peter . He is a guest in the home of Simon the tanner , who lives by the sea . ”
44010033	So I sent for you immediately , and it was good of you to come . Now we are all here in the presence of God to listen to everything the Lord has commanded you to tell us . ’
44010034	Then Peter began to speak : ‘ I now realise how true it is that God does not show favouritism
44010035	but accepts from every nation the one who fears him and does what is right .
44010036	You know the message God sent to the people of Israel , announcing the good news of peace through Jesus Christ , who is Lord of all .
44010037	You know what has happened throughout the province of Judea , beginning in Galilee after the baptism that John preached –
44010038	how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and power , and how he went around doing good and healing all who were under the power of the devil , because God was with him .
44010039	‘ We are witnesses of everything he did in the country of the Jews and in Jerusalem . They killed him by hanging him on a cross ,
44010040	but God raised him from the dead on the third day and caused him to be seen .
44010041	He was not seen by all the people , but by witnesses whom God had already chosen – by us who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead .
44010042	He commanded us to preach to the people and to testify that he is the one whom God appointed as judge of the living and the dead .
44010043	All the prophets testify about him that everyone who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins through his name . ’
44010044	While Peter was still speaking these words , the Holy Spirit came on all who heard the message .
44010045	The circumcised believers who had come with Peter were astonished that the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured out even on Gentiles .
44010046	For they heard them speaking in tongues and praising God . Then Peter said ,
44010047	‘ Surely no one can stand in the way of their being baptised with water . They have received the Holy Spirit just as we have . ’
44010048	So he ordered that they be baptised in the name of Jesus Christ . Then they asked Peter to stay with them for a few days .
44011001	The apostles and the believers throughout Judea heard that the Gentiles also had received the word of God .
44011002	So when Peter went up to Jerusalem , the circumcised believers criticised him
44011003	and said , ‘ You went into the house of uncircumcised men and ate with them . ’
44011004	Starting from the beginning , Peter told them the whole story :
44011005	‘ I was in the city of Joppa praying , and in a trance I saw a vision . I saw something like a large sheet being let down from heaven by its four corners , and it came down to where I was .
44011006	I looked into it and saw four-footed animals of the earth , wild beasts , reptiles and birds .
44011007	Then I heard a voice telling me , “ Get up , Peter . Kill and eat . ”
44011008	‘ I replied , “ Surely not , Lord ! Nothing impure or unclean has ever entered my mouth . ”
44011009	‘ The voice spoke from heaven a second time , “ Do not call anything impure that God has made clean . ”
44011010	This happened three times , and then it was all pulled up to heaven again .
44011011	‘ Right then three men who had been sent to me from Caesarea stopped at the house where I was staying .
44011012	The Spirit told me to have no hesitation about going with them . These six brothers also went with me , and we entered the man’s house .
44011013	He told us how he had seen an angel appear in his house and say , “ Send to Joppa for Simon who is called Peter .
44011014	He will bring you a message through which you and all your household will be saved . ”
44011015	‘ As I began to speak , the Holy Spirit came on them as he had come on us at the beginning .
44011016	Then I remembered what the Lord had said : “ John baptised with water , but you will be baptised with the Holy Spirit . ”
44011017	So if God gave them the same gift he gave us who believed in the Lord Jesus Christ , who was I to think that I could stand in God’s way ? ’
44011018	When they heard this , they had no further objections and praised God , saying , ‘ So then , even to Gentiles God has granted repentance that leads to life . ’
44011019	Now those who had been scattered by the persecution that broke out when Stephen was killed travelled as far as Phoenicia , Cyprus and Antioch , spreading the word only among Jews .
44011020	Some of them , however , men from Cyprus and Cyrene , went to Antioch and began to speak to Greeks also , telling them the good news about the Lord Jesus .
44011021	The Lord’s hand was with them , and a great number of people believed and turned to the Lord .
44011022	News of this reached the church in Jerusalem , and they sent Barnabas to Antioch .
44011023	When he arrived and saw what the grace of God had done , he was glad and encouraged them all to remain true to the Lord with all their hearts .
44011024	He was a good man , full of the Holy Spirit and faith , and a great number of people were brought to the Lord .
44011025	Then Barnabas went to Tarsus to look for Saul ,
44011026	and when he found him , he brought him to Antioch . So for a whole year Barnabas and Saul met with the church and taught great numbers of people . The disciples were called Christians first at Antioch .
44011027	During this time some prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch .
44011028	One of them , named Agabus , stood up and through the Spirit predicted that a severe famine would spread over the entire Roman world . ( This happened during the reign of Claudius . )
44011029	The disciples , as each one was able , decided to provide help for the brothers and sisters living in Judea .
44011030	This they did , sending their gift to the elders by Barnabas and Saul .
44012001	It was about this time that King Herod arrested some who belonged to the church , intending to persecute them .
44012002	He had James , the brother of John , put to death with the sword .
44012003	When he saw that this met with approval among the Jews , he proceeded to seize Peter also . This happened during the Festival of Unleavened Bread .
44012004	After arresting him , he put him in prison , handing him over to be guarded by four squads of four soldiers each . Herod intended to bring him out for public trial after the Passover .
44012005	So Peter was kept in prison , but the church was earnestly praying to God for him .
44012006	The night before Herod was to bring him to trial , Peter was sleeping between two soldiers , bound with two chains , and sentries stood guard at the entrance .
44012007	Suddenly an angel of the Lord appeared and a light shone in the cell . He struck Peter on the side and woke him up . ‘ Quick , get up ! ’ he said , and the chains fell off Peter’s wrists .
44012008	Then the angel said to him , ‘ Put on your clothes and sandals . ’ And Peter did so . ‘ Wrap your cloak round you and follow me , ’ the angel told him .
44012009	Peter followed him out of the prison , but he had no idea that what the angel was doing was really happening ; he thought he was seeing a vision .
44012010	They passed the first and second guards and came to the iron gate leading to the city . It opened for them by itself , and they went through it . When they had walked the length of one street , suddenly the angel left him .
44012011	Then Peter came to himself and said , ‘ Now I know without a doubt that the Lord has sent his angel and rescued me from Herod’s clutches and from everything the Jewish people were hoping would happen . ’
44012012	When this had dawned on him , he went to the house of Mary the mother of John , also called Mark , where many people had gathered and were praying .
44012013	Peter knocked at the outer entrance , and a servant named Rhoda came to answer the door .
44012014	When she recognised Peter’s voice , she was so overjoyed she ran back without opening it and exclaimed , ‘ Peter is at the door ! ’
44012015	‘ You’re out of your mind , ’ they told her . When she kept insisting that it was so , they said , ‘ It must be his angel . ’
44012016	But Peter kept on knocking , and when they opened the door and saw him , they were astonished .
44012017	Peter motioned with his hand for them to be quiet and described how the Lord had brought him out of prison . ‘ Tell James and the other brothers and sisters about this , ’ he said , and then he left for another place .
44012018	In the morning , there was no small commotion among the soldiers as to what had become of Peter .
44012019	After Herod had a thorough search made for him and did not find him , he cross-examined the guards and ordered that they be executed . Then Herod went from Judea to Caesarea and stayed there .
44012020	He had been quarrelling with the people of Tyre and Sidon ; they now joined together and sought an audience with him . After securing the support of Blastus , a trusted personal servant of the king , they asked for peace , because they depended on the king’s country for their food supply .
44012021	On the appointed day Herod , wearing his royal robes , sat on his throne and delivered a public address to the people .
44012022	They shouted , ‘ This is the voice of a god , not of a man . ’
44012023	Immediately , because Herod did not give praise to God , an angel of the Lord struck him down , and he was eaten by worms and died .
44012024	But the word of God continued to spread and flourish .
44012025	When Barnabas and Saul had finished their mission , they returned from Jerusalem , taking with them John , also called Mark .
44013001	Now in the church at Antioch there were prophets and teachers : Barnabas , Simeon called Niger , Lucius of Cyrene , Manaen ( who had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch ) and Saul .
44013002	While they were worshipping the Lord and fasting , the Holy Spirit said , ‘ Set apart for me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them . ’
44013003	So after they had fasted and prayed , they placed their hands on them and sent them off .
44013004	The two of them , sent on their way by the Holy Spirit , went down to Seleucia and sailed from there to Cyprus .
44013005	When they arrived at Salamis , they proclaimed the word of God in the Jewish synagogues . John was with them as their helper .
44013006	They travelled through the whole island until they came to Paphos . There they met a Jewish sorcerer and false prophet named Bar-Jesus ,
44013007	who was an attendant of the proconsul , Sergius Paulus . The proconsul , an intelligent man , sent for Barnabas and Saul because he wanted to hear the word of God .
44013008	But Elymas the sorcerer ( for that is what his name means ) opposed them and tried to turn the proconsul from the faith .
44013009	Then Saul , who was also called Paul , filled with the Holy Spirit , looked straight at Elymas and said ,
44013010	‘ You are a child of the devil and an enemy of everything that is right ! You are full of all kinds of deceit and trickery . Will you never stop perverting the right ways of the Lord ?
44013011	Now the hand of the Lord is against you . You are going to be blind for a time , not even able to see the light of the sun . ’ Immediately mist and darkness came over him , and he groped about , seeking someone to lead him by the hand .
44013012	When the proconsul saw what had happened , he believed , for he was amazed at the teaching about the Lord .
44013013	From Paphos , Paul and his companions sailed to Perga in Pamphylia , where John left them to return to Jerusalem .
44013014	From Perga they went on to Pisidian Antioch . On the Sabbath they entered the synagogue and sat down .
44013015	After the reading from the Law and the Prophets , the leaders of the synagogue sent word to them , saying , ‘ Brothers , if you have a word of exhortation for the people , please speak . ’
44013016	Standing up , Paul motioned with his hand and said : ‘ Fellow Israelites and you Gentiles who worship God , listen to me !
44013017	The God of the people of Israel chose our ancestors ; he made the people prosper during their stay in Egypt ; with mighty power he led them out of that country ;
44013018	for about forty years he endured their conduct in the wilderness ;
44013019	and he overthrew seven nations in Canaan , giving their land to his people as their inheritance .
44013020	All this took about 450 years . ‘ After this , God gave them judges until the time of Samuel the prophet .
44013021	Then the people asked for a king , and he gave them Saul son of Kish , of the tribe of Benjamin , who ruled for forty years .
44013022	After removing Saul , he made David their king . God testified concerning him : “ I have found David son of Jesse , a man after my own heart ; he will do everything I want him to do . ”
44013023	‘ From this man’s descendants God has brought to Israel the Saviour Jesus , as he promised .
44013024	Before the coming of Jesus , John preached repentance and baptism to all the people of Israel .
44013025	As John was completing his work , he said : “ Who do you suppose I am ? I am not the one you are looking for . But there is one coming after me whose sandals I am not worthy to untie . ”
44013026	‘ Fellow children of Abraham and you God-fearing Gentiles , it is to us that this message of salvation has been sent .
44013027	The people of Jerusalem and their rulers did not recognise Jesus , yet in condemning him they fulfilled the words of the prophets that are read every Sabbath .
44013028	Though they found no proper ground for a death sentence , they asked Pilate to have him executed .
44013029	When they had carried out all that was written about him , they took him down from the cross and laid him in a tomb .
44013030	But God raised him from the dead ,
44013031	and for many days he was seen by those who had travelled with him from Galilee to Jerusalem . They are now his witnesses to our people .
44013032	‘ We tell you the good news : what God promised our ancestors
44013033	he has fulfilled for us , their children , by raising up Jesus . As it is written in the second Psalm : ‘ “ You are my son ; today I have become your father . ” ‘ “ I will give you the holy and sure blessings promised to David . ” ‘ “ You will not let your holy one see decay . ”
44013036	‘ Now when David had served God’s purpose in his own generation , he fell asleep ; he was buried with his ancestors and his body decayed .
44013037	But the one whom God raised from the dead did not see decay .
44013038	‘ Therefore , my friends , I want you to know that through Jesus the forgiveness of sins is proclaimed to you .
44013039	Through him everyone who believes is set free from every sin , a justification you were not able to obtain under the law of Moses .
44013040	Take care that what the prophets have said does not happen to you :
44013041	‘ “ Look , you scoffers , wonder and perish , for I am going to do something in your days that you would never believe , even if someone told you . ” ’
44013042	As Paul and Barnabas were leaving the synagogue , the people invited them to speak further about these things on the next Sabbath .
44013043	When the congregation was dismissed , many of the Jews and devout converts to Judaism followed Paul and Barnabas , who talked with them and urged them to continue in the grace of God .
44013044	On the next Sabbath almost the whole city gathered to hear the word of the Lord .
44013045	When the Jews saw the crowds , they were filled with jealousy . They began to contradict what Paul was saying and heaped abuse on him .
44013046	Then Paul and Barnabas answered them boldly : ‘ We had to speak the word of God to you first . Since you reject it and do not consider yourselves worthy of eternal life , we now turn to the Gentiles .
44013047	For this is what the Lord has commanded us : ‘ “ I have made you a light for the Gentiles , that you may bring salvation to the ends of the earth . ” ’
44013048	When the Gentiles heard this , they were glad and honoured the word of the Lord ; and all who were appointed for eternal life believed .
44013049	The word of the Lord spread through the whole region .
44013050	But the Jewish leaders incited the God-fearing women of high standing and the leading men of the city . They stirred up persecution against Paul and Barnabas , and expelled them from their region .
44013051	So they shook the dust off their feet as a warning to them and went to Iconium .
44013052	And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit .
44014001	At Iconium Paul and Barnabas went as usual into the Jewish synagogue . There they spoke so effectively that a great number of Jews and Greeks believed .
44014002	But the Jews who refused to believe stirred up the other Gentiles and poisoned their minds against the brothers .
44014003	So Paul and Barnabas spent considerable time there , speaking boldly for the Lord , who confirmed the message of his grace by enabling them to perform signs and wonders .
44014004	The people of the city were divided ; some sided with the Jews , others with the apostles .
44014005	There was a plot afoot among both Gentiles and Jews , together with their leaders , to ill-treat them and stone them .
44014006	But they found out about it and fled to the Lycaonian cities of Lystra and Derbe and to the surrounding country ,
44014007	where they continued to preach the gospel .
44014008	In Lystra there sat a man who was lame . He had been that way from birth and had never walked .
44014009	He listened to Paul as he was speaking . Paul looked directly at him , saw that he had faith to be healed
44014010	and called out , ‘ Stand up on your feet ! ’ At that , the man jumped up and began to walk .
44014011	When the crowd saw what Paul had done , they shouted in the Lycaonian language , ‘ The gods have come down to us in human form ! ’
44014012	Barnabas they called Zeus , and Paul they called Hermes because he was the chief speaker .
44014013	The priest of Zeus , whose temple was just outside the city , brought bulls and wreaths to the city gates because he and the crowd wanted to offer sacrifices to them .
44014014	But when the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard of this , they tore their clothes and rushed out into the crowd , shouting :
44014015	‘ Friends , why are you doing this ? We too are only human , like you . We are bringing you good news , telling you to turn from these worthless things to the living God , who made the heavens and the earth and the sea and everything in them .
44014016	In the past , he let all nations go their own way .
44014017	Yet he has not left himself without testimony : he has shown kindness by giving you rain from heaven and crops in their seasons ; he provides you with plenty of food and fills your hearts with joy . ’
44014018	Even with these words , they had difficulty keeping the crowd from sacrificing to them .
44014019	Then some Jews came from Antioch and Iconium and won the crowd over . They stoned Paul and dragged him outside the city , thinking he was dead .
44014020	But after the disciples had gathered round him , he got up and went back into the city . The next day he and Barnabas left for Derbe .
44014021	They preached the gospel in that city and won a large number of disciples . Then they returned to Lystra , Iconium and Antioch ,
44014022	strengthening the disciples and encouraging them to remain true to the faith . ‘ We must go through many hardships to enter the kingdom of God , ’ they said .
44014023	Paul and Barnabas appointed elders for them in each church and , with prayer and fasting , committed them to the Lord , in whom they had put their trust .
44014024	After going through Pisidia , they came into Pamphylia ,
44014025	and when they had preached the word in Perga , they went down to Attalia .
44014026	From Attalia they sailed back to Antioch , where they had been committed to the grace of God for the work they had now completed .
44014027	On arriving there , they gathered the church together and reported all that God had done through them and how he had opened a door of faith to the Gentiles .
44014028	And they stayed there a long time with the disciples .
44015001	Certain people came down from Judea to Antioch and were teaching the believers : ‘ Unless you are circumcised , according to the custom taught by Moses , you cannot be saved . ’
44015002	This brought Paul and Barnabas into sharp dispute and debate with them . So Paul and Barnabas were appointed , along with some other believers , to go up to Jerusalem to see the apostles and elders about this question .
44015003	The church sent them on their way , and as they travelled through Phoenicia and Samaria , they told how the Gentiles had been converted . This news made all the believers very glad .
44015004	When they came to Jerusalem , they were welcomed by the church and the apostles and elders , to whom they reported everything God had done through them .
44015005	Then some of the believers who belonged to the party of the Pharisees stood up and said , ‘ The Gentiles must be circumcised and required to keep the law of Moses . ’
44015006	The apostles and elders met to consider this question .
44015007	After much discussion , Peter got up and addressed them : ‘ Brothers , you know that some time ago God made a choice among you that the Gentiles should hear from my lips the message of the gospel and believe .
44015008	God , who knows the heart , showed that he accepted them by giving the Holy Spirit to them , just as he did to us .
44015009	He did not discriminate between us and them , for he purified their hearts by faith .
44015010	Now then , why do you try to test God by putting on the necks of Gentiles a yoke that neither we nor our ancestors have been able to bear ?
44015011	No ! We believe it is through the grace of our Lord Jesus that we are saved , just as they are . ’
44015012	The whole assembly became silent as they listened to Barnabas and Paul telling about the signs and wonders God had done among the Gentiles through them .
44015013	When they finished , James spoke up . ‘ Brothers , ’ he said , ‘ listen to me .
44015014	Simon has described to us how God first intervened to choose a people for his name from the Gentiles .
44015015	The words of the prophets are in agreement with this , as it is written :
44015016	‘ “ After this I will return and rebuild David’s fallen tent . Its ruins I will rebuild , and I will restore it ,
44015017	that the rest of mankind may seek the Lord , even all the Gentiles who bear my name , says the Lord , who does these things ” –
44015018	things known from long ago .
44015019	‘ It is my judgment , therefore , that we should not make it difficult for the Gentiles who are turning to God .
44015020	Instead we should write to them , telling them to abstain from food polluted by idols , from sexual immorality , from the meat of strangled animals and from blood .
44015021	For the law of Moses has been preached in every city from the earliest times and is read in the synagogues on every Sabbath . ’
44015022	Then the apostles and elders , with the whole church , decided to choose some of their own men and send them to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas . They chose Judas ( called Barsabbas ) and Silas , men who were leaders among the believers .
44015023	With them they sent the following letter :
44015030	So the men were sent off and went down to Antioch , where they gathered the church together and delivered the letter .
44015031	The people read it and were glad for its encouraging message .
44015032	Judas and Silas , who themselves were prophets , said much to encourage and strengthen the believers .
44015033	After spending some time there , they were sent off by the believers with the blessing of peace to return to those who had sent them . [
44015035	But Paul and Barnabas remained in Antioch , where they and many others taught and preached the word of the Lord .
44015036	Some time later Paul said to Barnabas , ‘ Let us go back and visit the believers in all the towns where we preached the word of the Lord and see how they are doing . ’
44015037	Barnabas wanted to take John , also called Mark , with them ,
44015038	but Paul did not think it wise to take him , because he had deserted them in Pamphylia and had not continued with them in the work .
44015039	They had such a sharp disagreement that they parted company . Barnabas took Mark and sailed for Cyprus ,
44015040	but Paul chose Silas and left , commended by the believers to the grace of the Lord .
44015041	He went through Syria and Cilicia , strengthening the churches .
44016001	Paul came to Derbe and then to Lystra , where a disciple named Timothy lived , whose mother was Jewish and a believer but whose father was a Greek .
44016002	The believers at Lystra and Iconium spoke well of him .
44016003	Paul wanted to take him along on the journey , so he circumcised him because of the Jews who lived in that area , for they all knew that his father was a Greek .
44016004	As they travelled from town to town , they delivered the decisions reached by the apostles and elders in Jerusalem for the people to obey .
44016005	So the churches were strengthened in the faith and grew daily in numbers .
44016006	Paul and his companions travelled throughout the region of Phrygia and Galatia , having been kept by the Holy Spirit from preaching the word in the province of Asia .
44016007	When they came to the border of Mysia , they tried to enter Bithynia , but the Spirit of Jesus would not allow them to .
44016008	So they passed by Mysia and went down to Troas .
44016009	During the night Paul had a vision of a man of Macedonia standing and begging him , ‘ Come over to Macedonia and help us . ’
44016010	After Paul had seen the vision , we got ready at once to leave for Macedonia , concluding that God had called us to preach the gospel to them .
44016011	From Troas we put out to sea and sailed straight for Samothrace , and the next day we went on to Neapolis .
44016012	From there we travelled to Philippi , a Roman colony and the leading city of that district of Macedonia . And we stayed there several days .
44016013	On the Sabbath we went outside the city gate to the river , where we expected to find a place of prayer . We sat down and began to speak to the women who had gathered there .
44016014	One of those listening was a woman from the city of Thyatira named Lydia , a dealer in purple cloth . She was a worshipper of God . The Lord opened her heart to respond to Paul’s message .
44016015	When she and the members of her household were baptised , she invited us to her home . ‘ If you consider me a believer in the Lord , ’ she said , ‘ come and stay at my house . ’ And she persuaded us .
44016016	Once when we were going to the place of prayer , we were met by a female slave who had a spirit by which she predicted the future . She earned a great deal of money for her owners by fortune-telling .
44016017	She followed Paul and the rest of us , shouting , ‘ These men are servants of the Most High God , who are telling you the way to be saved . ’
44016018	She kept this up for many days . Finally Paul became so annoyed that he turned round and said to the spirit , ‘ In the name of Jesus Christ I command you to come out of her ! ’ At that moment the spirit left her .
44016019	When her owners realised that their hope of making money was gone , they seized Paul and Silas and dragged them into the market-place to face the authorities .
44016020	They brought them before the magistrates and said , ‘ These men are Jews , and are throwing our city into an uproar
44016021	by advocating customs unlawful for us Romans to accept or practise . ’
44016022	The crowd joined in the attack against Paul and Silas , and the magistrates ordered them to be stripped and beaten with rods .
44016023	After they had been severely flogged , they were thrown into prison , and the jailer was commanded to guard them carefully .
44016024	When he received these orders , he put them in the inner cell and fastened their feet in the stocks .
44016025	About midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God , and the other prisoners were listening to them .
44016026	Suddenly there was such a violent earthquake that the foundations of the prison were shaken . At once all the prison doors flew open , and everyone’s chains came loose .
44016027	The jailer woke up , and when he saw the prison doors open , he drew his sword and was about to kill himself because he thought the prisoners had escaped .
44016028	But Paul shouted , ‘ Don’t harm yourself ! We are all here ! ’
44016029	The jailer called for lights , rushed in and fell trembling before Paul and Silas .
44016030	He then brought them out and asked , ‘ Sirs , what must I do to be saved ? ’
44016031	They replied , ‘ Believe in the Lord Jesus , and you will be saved – you and your household . ’
44016032	Then they spoke the word of the Lord to him and to all the others in his house .
44016033	At that hour of the night the jailer took them and washed their wounds ; then immediately he and all his household were baptised .
44016034	The jailer brought them into his house and set a meal before them ; he was filled with joy because he had come to believe in God – he and his whole household .
44016035	When it was daylight , the magistrates sent their officers to the jailer with the order : ‘ Release those men . ’
44016036	The jailer told Paul , ‘ The magistrates have ordered that you and Silas be released . Now you can leave . Go in peace . ’
44016037	But Paul said to the officers : ‘ They beat us publicly without a trial , even though we are Roman citizens , and threw us into prison . And now do they want to get rid of us quietly ? No ! Let them come themselves and escort us out . ’
44016038	The officers reported this to the magistrates , and when they heard that Paul and Silas were Roman citizens , they were alarmed .
44016039	They came to appease them and escorted them from the prison , requesting them to leave the city .
44016040	After Paul and Silas came out of the prison , they went to Lydia’s house , where they met with the brothers and sisters and encouraged them . Then they left .
44017001	When Paul and his companions had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia , they came to Thessalonica , where there was a Jewish synagogue .
44017002	As was his custom , Paul went into the synagogue , and on three Sabbath days he reasoned with them from the Scriptures ,
44017003	explaining and proving that the Messiah had to suffer and rise from the dead . ‘ This Jesus I am proclaiming to you is the Messiah , ’ he said .
44017004	Some of the Jews were persuaded and joined Paul and Silas , as did a large number of God-fearing Greeks and quite a few prominent women .
44017005	But other Jews were jealous ; so they rounded up some bad characters from the market-place , formed a mob and started a riot in the city . They rushed to Jason’s house in search of Paul and Silas in order to bring them out to the crowd .
44017006	But when they did not find them , they dragged Jason and some other believers before the city officials , shouting : ‘ These men who have caused trouble all over the world have now come here ,
44017007	and Jason has welcomed them into his house . They are all defying Caesar’s decrees , saying that there is another king , one called Jesus . ’
44017008	When they heard this , the crowd and the city officials were thrown into turmoil .
44017009	Then they put Jason and the others on bail and let them go .
44017010	As soon as it was night , the believers sent Paul and Silas away to Berea . On arriving there , they went to the Jewish synagogue .
44017011	Now the Berean Jews were of more noble character than those in Thessalonica , for they received the message with great eagerness and examined the Scriptures every day to see if what Paul said was true .
44017012	As a result , many of them believed , as did also a number of prominent Greek women and many Greek men .
44017013	But when the Jews in Thessalonica learned that Paul was preaching the word of God at Berea , some of them went there too , agitating the crowds and stirring them up .
44017014	The believers immediately sent Paul to the coast , but Silas and Timothy stayed at Berea .
44017015	Those who escorted Paul brought him to Athens and then left with instructions for Silas and Timothy to join him as soon as possible .
44017016	While Paul was waiting for them in Athens , he was greatly distressed to see that the city was full of idols .
44017017	So he reasoned in the synagogue with both Jews and God-fearing Greeks , as well as in the market-place day by day with those who happened to be there .
44017018	A group of Epicurean and Stoic philosophers began to debate with him . Some of them asked , ‘ What is this babbler trying to say ? ’ Others remarked , ‘ He seems to be advocating foreign gods . ’ They said this because Paul was preaching the good news about Jesus and the resurrection .
44017019	Then they took him and brought him to a meeting of the Areopagus , where they said to him , ‘ May we know what this new teaching is that you are presenting ?
44017020	You are bringing some strange ideas to our ears , and we would like to know what they mean . ’
44017021	( All the Athenians and the foreigners who lived there spent their time doing nothing but talking about and listening to the latest ideas . )
44017022	Paul then stood up in the meeting of the Areopagus and said : ‘ People of Athens ! I see that in every way you are very religious .
44017023	For as I walked around and looked carefully at your objects of worship , I even found an altar with this inscription : to an unknown god . So you are ignorant of the very thing you worship – and this is what I am going to proclaim to you .
44017024	‘ The God who made the world and everything in it is the Lord of heaven and earth and does not live in temples built by human hands .
44017025	And he is not served by human hands , as if he needed anything . Rather , he himself gives everyone life and breath and everything else .
44017026	From one man he made all the nations , that they should inhabit the whole earth ; and he marked out their appointed times in history and the boundaries of their lands .
44017027	God did this so that they would seek him and perhaps reach out for him and find him , though he is not far from any one of us .
44017028	“ For in him we live and move and have our being . ” As some of your own poets have said , “ We are his offspring . ”
44017029	‘ Therefore since we are God’s offspring , we should not think that the divine being is like gold or silver or stone – an image made by human design and skill .
44017030	In the past God overlooked such ignorance , but now he commands all people everywhere to repent .
44017031	For he has set a day when he will judge the world with justice by the man he has appointed . He has given proof of this to everyone by raising him from the dead . ’
44017032	When they heard about the resurrection of the dead , some of them sneered , but others said , ‘ We want to hear you again on this subject . ’
44017033	At that , Paul left the Council .
44017034	Some of the people became followers of Paul and believed . Among them was Dionysius , a member of the Areopagus , also a woman named Damaris , and a number of others .
44018001	After this , Paul left Athens and went to Corinth .
44018002	There he met a Jew named Aquila , a native of Pontus , who had recently come from Italy with his wife Priscilla , because Claudius had ordered all Jews to leave Rome . Paul went to see them ,
44018003	and because he was a tentmaker as they were , he stayed and worked with them .
44018004	Every Sabbath he reasoned in the synagogue , trying to persuade Jews and Greeks .
44018005	When Silas and Timothy came from Macedonia , Paul devoted himself exclusively to preaching , testifying to the Jews that Jesus was the Messiah .
44018006	But when they opposed Paul and became abusive , he shook out his clothes in protest and said to them , ‘ Your blood be on your own heads ! I am innocent of it . From now on I will go to the Gentiles . ’
44018007	Then Paul left the synagogue and went next door to the house of Titius Justus , a worshipper of God .
44018008	Crispus , the synagogue leader , and his entire household believed in the Lord ; and many of the Corinthians who heard Paul believed and were baptised .
44018009	One night the Lord spoke to Paul in a vision : ‘ Do not be afraid ; keep on speaking , do not be silent .
44018010	For I am with you , and no one is going to attack and harm you , because I have many people in this city . ’
44018011	So Paul stayed in Corinth for a year and a half , teaching them the word of God .
44018012	While Gallio was proconsul of Achaia , the Jews of Corinth made a united attack on Paul and brought him to the place of judgment .
44018013	‘ This man , ’ they charged , ‘ is persuading the people to worship God in ways contrary to the law . ’
44018014	Just as Paul was about to speak , Gallio said to them , ‘ If you Jews were making a complaint about some misdemeanour or serious crime , it would be reasonable for me to listen to you .
44018015	But since it involves questions about words and names and your own law – settle the matter yourselves . I will not be a judge of such things . ’
44018016	So he drove them off .
44018017	Then the crowd there turned on Sosthenes the synagogue leader and beat him in front of the proconsul ; and Gallio showed no concern whatever .
44018018	Paul stayed on in Corinth for some time . Then he left the brothers and sisters and sailed for Syria , accompanied by Priscilla and Aquila . Before he sailed , he had his hair cut off at Cenchreae because of a vow he had taken .
44018019	They arrived at Ephesus , where Paul left Priscilla and Aquila . He himself went into the synagogue and reasoned with the Jews .
44018020	When they asked him to spend more time with them , he declined .
44018021	But as he left , he promised , ‘ I will come back if it is God’s will . ’ Then he set sail from Ephesus .
44018022	When he landed at Caesarea , he went up to Jerusalem and greeted the church and then went down to Antioch .
44018023	After spending some time in Antioch , Paul set out from there and travelled from place to place throughout the region of Galatia and Phrygia , strengthening all the disciples .
44018024	Meanwhile a Jew named Apollos , a native of Alexandria , came to Ephesus . He was a learned man , with a thorough knowledge of the Scriptures .
44018025	He had been instructed in the way of the Lord , and he spoke with great fervour and taught about Jesus accurately , though he knew only the baptism of John .
44018026	He began to speak boldly in the synagogue . When Priscilla and Aquila heard him , they invited him to their home and explained to him the way of God more adequately .
44018027	When Apollos wanted to go to Achaia , the brothers and sisters encouraged him and wrote to the disciples there to welcome him . When he arrived , he was a great help to those who by grace had believed .
44018028	For he vigorously refuted his Jewish opponents in public debate , proving from the Scriptures that Jesus was the Messiah .
44019001	While Apollos was at Corinth , Paul took the road through the interior and arrived at Ephesus . There he found some disciples
44019002	and asked them , ‘ Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you believed ? ’ They answered , ‘ No , we have not even heard that there is a Holy Spirit . ’
44019003	So Paul asked , ‘ Then what baptism did you receive ? ’ ‘ John’s baptism , ’ they replied .
44019004	Paul said , ‘ John’s baptism was a baptism of repentance . He told the people to believe in the one coming after him , that is , in Jesus . ’
44019005	On hearing this , they were baptised in the name of the Lord Jesus .
44019006	When Paul placed his hands on them , the Holy Spirit came on them , and they spoke in tongues and prophesied .
44019007	There were about twelve men in all .
44019008	Paul entered the synagogue and spoke boldly there for three months , arguing persuasively about the kingdom of God .
44019009	But some of them became obstinate ; they refused to believe and publicly maligned the Way . So Paul left them . He took the disciples with him and had discussions daily in the lecture hall of Tyrannus .
44019010	This went on for two years , so that all the Jews and Greeks who lived in the province of Asia heard the word of the Lord .
44019011	God did extraordinary miracles through Paul ,
44019012	so that even handkerchiefs and aprons that had touched him were taken to those who were ill , and their illnesses were cured and the evil spirits left them .
44019013	Some Jews who went around driving out evil spirits tried to invoke the name of the Lord Jesus over those who were demon-possessed . They would say , ‘ In the name of the Jesus whom Paul preaches , I command you to come out . ’
44019014	Seven sons of Sceva , a Jewish chief priest , were doing this .
44019015	One day the evil spirit answered them , ‘ Jesus I know , and Paul I know about , but who are you ? ’
44019016	Then the man who had the evil spirit jumped on them and overpowered them all . He gave them such a beating that they ran out of the house naked and bleeding .
44019017	When this became known to the Jews and Greeks living in Ephesus , they were all seized with fear , and the name of the Lord Jesus was held in high honour .
44019018	Many of those who believed now came and openly confessed what they had done .
44019019	A number who had practised sorcery brought their scrolls together and burned them publicly . When they calculated the value of the scrolls , the total came to fifty thousand drachmas .
44019020	In this way the word of the Lord spread widely and grew in power .
44019021	After all this had happened , Paul decided to go to Jerusalem , passing through Macedonia and Achaia . ‘ After I have been there , ’ he said , ‘ I must visit Rome also . ’
44019022	He sent two of his helpers , Timothy and Erastus , to Macedonia , while he stayed in the province of Asia a little longer .
44019023	About that time there arose a great disturbance about the Way .
44019024	A silversmith named Demetrius , who made silver shrines of Artemis , brought in a lot of business for the craftsmen there .
44019025	He called them together , along with the workers in related trades , and said : ‘ You know , my friends , that we receive a good income from this business .
44019026	And you see and hear how this fellow Paul has convinced and led astray large numbers of people here in Ephesus and in practically the whole province of Asia . He says that gods made by human hands are no gods at all .
44019027	There is danger not only that our trade will lose its good name , but also that the temple of the great goddess Artemis will be discredited ; and the goddess herself , who is worshipped throughout the province of Asia and the world , will be robbed of her divine majesty . ’
44019028	When they heard this , they were furious and began shouting : ‘ Great is Artemis of the Ephesians ! ’
44019029	Soon the whole city was in an uproar . The people seized Gaius and Aristarchus , Paul’s travelling companions from Macedonia , and all of them rushed into the theatre together .
44019030	Paul wanted to appear before the crowd , but the disciples would not let him .
44019031	Even some of the officials of the province , friends of Paul , sent him a message begging him not to venture into the theatre .
44019032	The assembly was in confusion : some were shouting one thing , some another . Most of the people did not even know why they were there .
44019033	The Jews in the crowd pushed Alexander to the front , and they shouted instructions to him . He motioned for silence in order to make a defence before the people .
44019034	But when they realised he was a Jew , they all shouted in unison for about two hours : ‘ Great is Artemis of the Ephesians ! ’
44019035	The city clerk quietened the crowd and said : ‘ Fellow Ephesians , doesn’t all the world know that the city of Ephesus is the guardian of the temple of the great Artemis and of her image , which fell from heaven ?
44019036	Therefore , since these facts are undeniable , you ought to calm down and not do anything rash .
44019037	You have brought these men here , though they have neither robbed temples nor blasphemed our goddess .
44019038	If , then , Demetrius and his fellow craftsmen have a grievance against anybody , the courts are open and there are proconsuls . They can press charges .
44019039	If there is anything further you want to bring up , it must be settled in a legal assembly .
44019040	As it is , we are in danger of being charged with rioting because of what happened today . In that case we would not be able to account for this commotion , since there is no reason for it . ’
44019041	After he had said this , he dismissed the assembly .
44020001	When the uproar had ended , Paul sent for the disciples and , after encouraging them , said goodbye and set out for Macedonia .
44020002	He travelled through that area , speaking many words of encouragement to the people , and finally arrived in Greece ,
44020003	where he stayed three months . Because some Jews had plotted against him just as he was about to sail for Syria , he decided to go back through Macedonia .
44020004	He was accompanied by Sopater son of Pyrrhus from Berea , Aristarchus and Secundus from Thessalonica , Gaius from Derbe , Timothy also , and Tychicus and Trophimus from the province of Asia .
44020005	These men went on ahead and waited for us at Troas .
44020006	But we sailed from Philippi after the Festival of Unleavened Bread , and five days later joined the others at Troas , where we stayed seven days .
44020007	On the first day of the week we came together to break bread . Paul spoke to the people and , because he intended to leave the next day , kept on talking until midnight .
44020008	There were many lamps in the upstairs room where we were meeting .
44020009	Seated in a window was a young man named Eutychus , who was sinking into a deep sleep as Paul talked on and on . When he was sound asleep , he fell to the ground from the third storey and was picked up dead .
44020010	Paul went down , threw himself on the young man and put his arms round him . ‘ Don’t be alarmed , ’ he said . ‘ He’s alive ! ’
44020011	Then he went upstairs again and broke bread and ate . After talking until daylight , he left .
44020012	The people took the young man home alive and were greatly comforted .
44020013	We went on ahead to the ship and sailed for Assos , where we were going to take Paul aboard . He had made this arrangement because he was going there on foot .
44020014	When he met us at Assos , we took him aboard and went on to Mitylene .
44020015	The next day we set sail from there and arrived off Chios . The day after that we crossed over to Samos , and on the following day arrived at Miletus .
44020016	Paul had decided to sail past Ephesus to avoid spending time in the province of Asia , for he was in a hurry to reach Jerusalem , if possible , by the day of Pentecost .
44020017	From Miletus , Paul sent to Ephesus for the elders of the church .
44020018	When they arrived , he said to them : ‘ You know how I lived the whole time I was with you , from the first day I came into the province of Asia .
44020019	I served the Lord with great humility and with tears and in the midst of severe testing by the plots of my Jewish opponents .
44020020	You know that I have not hesitated to preach anything that would be helpful to you but have taught you publicly and from house to house .
44020021	I have declared to both Jews and Greeks that they must turn to God in repentance and have faith in our Lord Jesus .
44020022	‘ And now , compelled by the Spirit , I am going to Jerusalem , not knowing what will happen to me there .
44020023	I only know that in every city the Holy Spirit warns me that prison and hardships are facing me .
44020024	However , I consider my life worth nothing to me ; my only aim is to finish the race and complete the task the Lord Jesus has given me – the task of testifying to the good news of God’s grace .
44020025	‘ Now I know that none of you among whom I have gone about preaching the kingdom will ever see me again .
44020026	Therefore , I declare to you today that I am innocent of the blood of any of you .
44020027	For I have not hesitated to proclaim to you the whole will of God .
44020028	Keep watch over yourselves and all the flock of which the Holy Spirit has made you overseers . Be shepherds of the church of God , which he bought with his own blood .
44020029	I know that after I leave , savage wolves will come in among you and will not spare the flock .
44020030	Even from your own number men will arise and distort the truth in order to draw away disciples after them .
44020031	So be on your guard ! Remember that for three years I never stopped warning each of you night and day with tears .
44020032	‘ Now I commit you to God and to the word of his grace , which can build you up and give you an inheritance among all those who are sanctified .
44020033	I have not coveted anyone’s silver or gold or clothing .
44020034	You yourselves know that these hands of mine have supplied my own needs and the needs of my companions .
44020035	In everything I did , I showed you that by this kind of hard work we must help the weak , remembering the words the Lord Jesus himself said : “ It is more blessed to give than to receive . ” ’
44020036	When Paul had finished speaking , he knelt down with all of them and prayed .
44020037	They all wept as they embraced him and kissed him .
44020038	What grieved them most was his statement that they would never see his face again . Then they accompanied him to the ship .
44021001	After we had torn ourselves away from them , we put out to sea and sailed straight to Kos . The next day we went to Rhodes and from there to Patara .
44021002	We found a ship crossing over to Phoenicia , went on board and set sail .
44021003	After sighting Cyprus and passing to the south of it , we sailed on to Syria . We landed at Tyre , where our ship was to unload its cargo .
44021004	We sought out the disciples there and stayed with them seven days . Through the Spirit they urged Paul not to go on to Jerusalem .
44021005	When it was time to leave , we left and continued on our way . All of them , including wives and children , accompanied us out of the city , and there on the beach we knelt to pray .
44021006	After saying goodbye to each other , we went aboard the ship , and they returned home .
44021007	We continued our voyage from Tyre and landed at Ptolemais , where we greeted the brothers and sisters and stayed with them for a day .
44021008	Leaving the next day , we reached Caesarea and stayed at the house of Philip the evangelist , one of the Seven .
44021009	He had four unmarried daughters who prophesied .
44021010	After we had been there a number of days , a prophet named Agabus came down from Judea .
44021011	Coming over to us , he took Paul’s belt , tied his own hands and feet with it and said , ‘ The Holy Spirit says , “ In this way the Jewish leaders in Jerusalem will bind the owner of this belt and will hand him over to the Gentiles . ” ’
44021012	When we heard this , we and the people there pleaded with Paul not to go up to Jerusalem .
44021013	Then Paul answered , ‘ Why are you weeping and breaking my heart ? I am ready not only to be bound , but also to die in Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus . ’
44021014	When he would not be dissuaded , we gave up and said , ‘ The Lord’s will be done . ’
44021015	After this , we started on our way up to Jerusalem .
44021016	Some of the disciples from Caesarea accompanied us and brought us to the home of Mnason , where we were to stay . He was a man from Cyprus and one of the early disciples .
44021017	When we arrived at Jerusalem , the brothers and sisters received us warmly .
44021018	The next day Paul and the rest of us went to see James , and all the elders were present .
44021019	Paul greeted them and reported in detail what God had done among the Gentiles through his ministry .
44021020	When they heard this , they praised God . Then they said to Paul : ‘ You see , brother , how many thousands of Jews have believed , and all of them are zealous for the law .
44021021	They have been informed that you teach all the Jews who live among the Gentiles to turn away from Moses , telling them not to circumcise their children or live according to our customs .
44021022	What shall we do ? They will certainly hear that you have come ,
44021023	so do what we tell you . There are four men with us who have made a vow .
44021024	Take these men , join in their purification rites and pay their expenses , so that they can have their heads shaved . Then everyone will know there is no truth in these reports about you , but that you yourself are living in obedience to the law .
44021025	As for the Gentile believers , we have written to them our decision that they should abstain from food sacrificed to idols , from blood , from the meat of strangled animals and from sexual immorality . ’
44021026	The next day Paul took the men and purified himself along with them . Then he went to the temple to give notice of the date when the days of purification would end and the offering would be made for each of them .
44021027	When the seven days were nearly over , some Jews from the province of Asia saw Paul at the temple . They stirred up the whole crowd and seized him ,
44021028	shouting , ‘ Fellow Israelites , help us ! This is the man who teaches everyone everywhere against our people and our law and this place . And besides , he has brought Greeks into the temple and defiled this holy place . ’
44021029	( They had previously seen Trophimus the Ephesian in the city with Paul and assumed that Paul had brought him into the temple . )
44021030	The whole city was aroused , and the people came running from all directions . Seizing Paul , they dragged him from the temple , and immediately the gates were shut .
44021031	While they were trying to kill him , news reached the commander of the Roman troops that the whole city of Jerusalem was in an uproar .
44021032	He at once took some officers and soldiers and ran down to the crowd . When the rioters saw the commander and his soldiers , they stopped beating Paul .
44021033	The commander came up and arrested him and ordered him to be bound with two chains . Then he asked who he was and what he had done .
44021034	Some in the crowd shouted one thing and some another , and since the commander could not get at the truth because of the uproar , he ordered that Paul be taken into the barracks .
44021035	When Paul reached the steps , the violence of the mob was so great he had to be carried by the soldiers .
44021036	The crowd that followed kept shouting , ‘ Get rid of him ! ’
44021037	As the soldiers were about to take Paul into the barracks , he asked the commander , ‘ May I say something to you ? ’ ‘ Do you speak Greek ? ’ he replied .
44021038	‘ Aren’t you the Egyptian who started a revolt and led four thousand terrorists out into the wilderness some time ago ? ’
44021039	Paul answered , ‘ I am a Jew , from Tarsus in Cilicia , a citizen of no ordinary city . Please let me speak to the people . ’
44021040	After receiving the commander’s permission , Paul stood on the steps and motioned to the crowd . When they were all silent , he said to them in Aramaic :
44022001	‘ Brothers and fathers , listen now to my defence . ’
44022002	When they heard him speak to them in Aramaic , they became very quiet . Then Paul said :
44022003	‘ I am a Jew , born in Tarsus of Cilicia , but brought up in this city . I studied under Gamaliel and was thoroughly trained in the law of our ancestors . I was just as zealous for God as any of you are today .
44022004	I persecuted the followers of this Way to their death , arresting both men and women and throwing them into prison ,
44022005	as the high priest and all the Council can themselves testify . I even obtained letters from them to their associates in Damascus , and went there to bring these people as prisoners to Jerusalem to be punished .
44022006	‘ About noon as I came near Damascus , suddenly a bright light from heaven flashed around me .
44022007	I fell to the ground and heard a voice say to me , “ Saul ! Saul ! Why do you persecute me ? ”
44022008	‘ “ Who are you , Lord ? ” I asked . ‘ “ I am Jesus of Nazareth , whom you are persecuting , ” he replied .
44022009	My companions saw the light , but they did not understand the voice of him who was speaking to me .
44022010	‘ “ What shall I do , Lord ? ” I asked . ‘ “ Get up , ” the Lord said , “ and go into Damascus . There you will be told all that you have been assigned to do . ”
44022011	My companions led me by the hand into Damascus , because the brilliance of the light had blinded me .
44022012	‘ A man named Ananias came to see me . He was a devout observer of the law and highly respected by all the Jews living there .
44022013	He stood beside me and said , “ Brother Saul , receive your sight ! ” And at that very moment I was able to see him .
44022014	‘ Then he said : “ The God of our ancestors has chosen you to know his will and to see the Righteous One and to hear words from his mouth .
44022015	You will be his witness to all people of what you have seen and heard .
44022016	And now what are you waiting for ? Get up , be baptised and wash your sins away , calling on his name . ”
44022017	‘ When I returned to Jerusalem and was praying at the temple , I fell into a trance
44022018	and saw the Lord speaking to me . “ Quick ! ” he said . “ Leave Jerusalem immediately , because the people here will not accept your testimony about me . ”
44022019	‘ “ Lord , ” I replied , “ these people know that I went from one synagogue to another to imprison and beat those who believe in you .
44022020	And when the blood of your martyr Stephen was shed , I stood there giving my approval and guarding the clothes of those who were killing him . ”
44022021	‘ Then the Lord said to me , “ Go ; I will send you far away to the Gentiles . ” ’
44022022	The crowd listened to Paul until he said this . Then they raised their voices and shouted , ‘ Rid the earth of him ! He’s not fit to live ! ’
44022023	As they were shouting and throwing off their cloaks and flinging dust into the air ,
44022024	the commander ordered that Paul be taken into the barracks . He directed that he be flogged and interrogated in order to find out why the people were shouting at him like this .
44022025	As they stretched him out to flog him , Paul said to the centurion standing there , ‘ Is it legal for you to flog a Roman citizen who hasn’t even been found guilty ? ’
44022026	When the centurion heard this , he went to the commander and reported it . ‘ What are you going to do ? ’ he asked . ‘ This man is a Roman citizen . ’
44022027	The commander went to Paul and asked , ‘ Tell me , are you a Roman citizen ? ’ ‘ Yes , I am , ’ he answered .
44022028	Then the commander said , ‘ I had to pay a lot of money for my citizenship . ’ ‘ But I was born a citizen , ’ Paul replied .
44022029	Those who were about to interrogate him withdrew immediately . The commander himself was alarmed when he realised that he had put Paul , a Roman citizen , in chains .
44022030	The commander wanted to find out exactly why Paul was being accused by the Jews . So the next day he released him and ordered the chief priests and all the members of the Sanhedrin to assemble . Then he brought Paul and set him before them .
44023001	Paul looked straight at the Sanhedrin and said , ‘ My brothers , I have fulfilled my duty to God in all good conscience to this day . ’
44023002	At this the high priest Ananias ordered those standing near Paul to strike him on the mouth .
44023003	Then Paul said to him , ‘ God will strike you , you whitewashed wall ! You sit there to judge me according to the law , yet you yourself violate the law by commanding that I be struck ! ’
44023004	Those who were standing near Paul said , ‘ How dare you insult God’s high priest ! ’
44023005	Paul replied , ‘ Brothers , I did not realise that he was the high priest ; for it is written : “ Do not speak evil about the ruler of your people . ” ’
44023006	Then Paul , knowing that some of them were Sadducees and the others Pharisees , called out in the Sanhedrin , ‘ My brothers , I am a Pharisee , descended from Pharisees . I stand on trial because of the hope of the resurrection of the dead . ’
44023007	When he said this , a dispute broke out between the Pharisees and the Sadducees , and the assembly was divided .
44023008	( The Sadducees say that there is no resurrection , and that there are neither angels nor spirits , but the Pharisees believe all these things . )
44023009	There was a great uproar , and some of the teachers of the law who were Pharisees stood up and argued vigorously . ‘ We find nothing wrong with this man , ’ they said . ‘ What if a spirit or an angel has spoken to him ? ’
44023010	The dispute became so violent that the commander was afraid Paul would be torn to pieces by them . He ordered the troops to go down and take him away from them by force and bring him into the barracks .
44023011	The following night the Lord stood near Paul and said , ‘ Take courage ! As you have testified about me in Jerusalem , so you must also testify in Rome . ’
44023012	The next morning some Jews formed a conspiracy and bound themselves with an oath not to eat or drink until they had killed Paul .
44023013	More than forty men were involved in this plot .
44023014	They went to the chief priests and the elders and said , ‘ We have taken a solemn oath not to eat anything until we have killed Paul .
44023015	Now then , you and the Sanhedrin petition the commander to bring him before you on the pretext of wanting more accurate information about his case . We are ready to kill him before he gets here . ’
44023016	But when the son of Paul’s sister heard of this plot , he went into the barracks and told Paul .
44023017	Then Paul called one of the centurions and said , ‘ Take this young man to the commander ; he has something to tell him . ’
44023018	So he took him to the commander . The centurion said , ‘ Paul , the prisoner , sent for me and asked me to bring this young man to you because he has something to tell you . ’
44023019	The commander took the young man by the hand , drew him aside and asked , ‘ What is it you want to tell me ? ’
44023020	He said : ‘ Some Jews have agreed to ask you to bring Paul before the Sanhedrin tomorrow on the pretext of wanting more accurate information about him .
44023021	Don’t give in to them , because more than forty of them are waiting in ambush for him . They have taken an oath not to eat or drink until they have killed him . They are ready now , waiting for your consent to their request . ’
44023022	The commander dismissed the young man with this warning : ‘ Don’t tell anyone that you have reported this to me . ’
44023023	Then he called two of his centurions and ordered them , ‘ Get ready a detachment of two hundred soldiers , seventy horsemen and two hundred spearmen to go to Caesarea at nine tonight .
44023024	Provide horses for Paul so that he may be taken safely to Governor Felix . ’
44023025	He wrote a letter as follows :
44023031	So the soldiers , carrying out their orders , took Paul with them during the night and brought him as far as Antipatris .
44023032	The next day they let the cavalry go on with him , while they returned to the barracks .
44023033	When the cavalry arrived in Caesarea , they delivered the letter to the governor and handed Paul over to him .
44023034	The governor read the letter and asked what province he was from . Learning that he was from Cilicia ,
44023035	he said , ‘ I will hear your case when your accusers get here . ’ Then he ordered that Paul be kept under guard in Herod’s palace .
44024001	Five days later the high priest Ananias went down to Caesarea with some of the elders and a lawyer named Tertullus , and they brought their charges against Paul before the governor .
44024002	When Paul was called in , Tertullus presented his case before Felix : ‘ We have enjoyed a long period of peace under you , and your foresight has brought about reforms in this nation .
44024003	Everywhere and in every way , most excellent Felix , we acknowledge this with profound gratitude .
44024004	But in order not to weary you further , I would request that you be kind enough to hear us briefly .
44024005	‘ We have found this man to be a troublemaker , stirring up riots among the Jews all over the world . He is a ringleader of the Nazarene sect
44024006	and even tried to desecrate the temple ; so we seized him . [
44024008	By examining him yourself you will be able to learn the truth about all these charges we are bringing against him . ’
44024009	The other Jews joined in the accusation , asserting that these things were true .
44024010	When the governor motioned for him to speak , Paul replied : ‘ I know that for a number of years you have been a judge over this nation ; so I gladly make my defence .
44024011	You can easily verify that no more than twelve days ago I went up to Jerusalem to worship .
44024012	My accusers did not find me arguing with anyone at the temple , or stirring up a crowd in the synagogues or anywhere else in the city .
44024013	And they cannot prove to you the charges they are now making against me .
44024014	However , I admit that I worship the God of our ancestors as a follower of the Way , which they call a sect . I believe everything that is in accordance with the Law and that is written in the Prophets ,
44024015	and I have the same hope in God as these men themselves have , that there will be a resurrection of both the righteous and the wicked .
44024016	So I strive always to keep my conscience clear before God and man .
44024017	‘ After an absence of several years , I came to Jerusalem to bring my people gifts for the poor and to present offerings .
44024018	I was ceremonially clean when they found me in the temple courts doing this . There was no crowd with me , nor was I involved in any disturbance .
44024019	But there are some Jews from the province of Asia , who ought to be here before you and bring charges if they have anything against me .
44024020	Or these who are here should state what crime they found in me when I stood before the Sanhedrin –
44024021	unless it was this one thing I shouted as I stood in their presence : “ It is concerning the resurrection of the dead that I am on trial before you today . ” ’
44024022	Then Felix , who was well acquainted with the Way , adjourned the proceedings . ‘ When Lysias the commander comes , ’ he said , ‘ I will decide your case . ’
44024023	He ordered the centurion to keep Paul under guard but to give him some freedom and permit his friends to take care of his needs .
44024024	Several days later Felix came with his wife Drusilla , who was Jewish . He sent for Paul and listened to him as he spoke about faith in Christ Jesus .
44024025	As Paul talked about righteousness , self-control and the judgment to come , Felix was afraid and said , ‘ That’s enough for now ! You may leave . When I find it convenient , I will send for you . ’
44024026	At the same time he was hoping that Paul would offer him a bribe , so he sent for him frequently and talked with him .
