46002004	My message and my preaching were not with wise and persuasive words , but with a demonstration of the Spirit’s power ,
46002005	so that your faith might not rest on human wisdom , but on God’s power .
46002006	We do , however , speak a message of wisdom among the mature , but not the wisdom of this age or of the rulers of this age , who are coming to nothing .
46002007	No , we declare God’s wisdom , a mystery that has been hidden and that God destined for our glory before time began .
46002008	None of the rulers of this age understood it , for if they had , they would not have crucified the Lord of glory .
46002009	However , as it is written : ‘ What no eye has seen , what no ear has heard , and what no human mind has conceived ’ – the things God has prepared for those who love him – The Spirit searches all things , even the deep things of God .
46002011	For who knows a person’s thoughts except their own spirit within them ? In the same way no one knows the thoughts of God except the Spirit of God .
46002012	What we have received is not the spirit of the world , but the Spirit who is from God , so that we may understand what God has freely given us .
46002013	This is what we speak , not in words taught us by human wisdom but in words taught by the Spirit , explaining spiritual realities with Spirit-taught words .
46002014	The person without the Spirit does not accept the things that come from the Spirit of God but considers them foolishness , and cannot understand them because they are discerned only through the Spirit .
46002015	The person with the Spirit makes judgments about all things , but such a person is not subject to merely human judgments ,
46002016	for , ‘ Who has known the mind of the Lord so as to instruct him ? ’
46003001	Brothers and sisters , I could not address you as people who live by the Spirit but as people who are still worldly – mere infants in Christ .
46003002	I gave you milk , not solid food , for you were not yet ready for it . Indeed , you are still not ready .
46003003	You are still worldly . For since there is jealousy and quarrelling among you , are you not worldly ? Are you not acting like mere humans ?
46003004	For when one says , ‘ I follow Paul , ’ and another , ‘ I follow Apollos , ’ are you not mere human beings ?
46003005	What , after all , is Apollos ? And what is Paul ? Only servants , through whom you came to believe – as the Lord has assigned to each his task .
46003006	I planted the seed , Apollos watered it , but God has been making it grow .
46003007	So neither the one who plants nor the one who waters is anything , but only God , who makes things grow .
46003008	The one who plants and the one who waters have one purpose , and they will each be rewarded according to their own labour .
46003009	For we are fellow workers in God’s service ; you are God’s field , God’s building .
46003010	By the grace God has given me , I laid a foundation as a wise builder , and someone else is building on it . But each one should build with care .
46003011	For no one can lay any foundation other than the one already laid , which is Jesus Christ .
46003012	If anyone builds on this foundation using gold , silver , costly stones , wood , hay or straw ,
46003013	their work will be shown for what it is , because the Day will bring it to light . It will be revealed with fire , and the fire will test the quality of each person’s work .
46003014	If what has been built survives , the builder will receive a reward .
46003015	If it is burned up , the builder will suffer loss but yet will be saved – even though only as one escaping through the flames .
46003016	Don’t you know that you yourselves are God’s temple and that God’s Spirit lives among you ?
46003017	If anyone destroys God’s temple , God will destroy that person ; for God’s temple is sacred , and you together are that temple .
46003018	Do not deceive yourselves . If any of you think you are wise by the standards of this age , you should become ‘ fools’ so that you may become wise .
46003019	For the wisdom of this world is foolishness in God’s sight . As it is written : ‘ He catches the wise in their craftiness’ ;
46003020	and again , ‘ The Lord knows that the thoughts of the wise are futile . ’
46003021	So then , no more boasting about human leaders ! All things are yours ,
46003022	whether Paul or Apollos or Cephas or the world or life or death or the present or the future – all are yours ,
46003023	and you are of Christ , and Christ is of God .
46004001	This , then , is how you ought to regard us : as servants of Christ and as those entrusted with the mysteries God has revealed .
46004002	Now it is required that those who have been given a trust must prove faithful .
46004003	I care very little if I am judged by you or by any human court ; indeed , I do not even judge myself .
46004004	My conscience is clear , but that does not make me innocent . It is the Lord who judges me .
46004005	Therefore judge nothing before the appointed time ; wait until the Lord comes . He will bring to light what is hidden in darkness and will expose the motives of the heart . At that time each will receive their praise from God .
46004006	Now , brothers and sisters , I have applied these things to myself and Apollos for your benefit , so that you may learn from us the meaning of the saying , ‘ Do not go beyond what is written . ’ Then you will not be puffed up in being a follower of one of us over against the other .
46004007	For who makes you different from anyone else ? What do you have that you did not receive ? And if you did receive it , why do you boast as though you did not ?
46004008	Already you have all you want ! Already you have become rich ! You have begun to reign – and that without us ! How I wish that you really had begun to reign so that we also might reign with you !
46004009	For it seems to me that God has put us apostles on display at the end of the procession , like those condemned to die in the arena . We have been made a spectacle to the whole universe , to angels as well as to human beings .
46004010	We are fools for Christ , but you are so wise in Christ ! We are weak , but you are strong ! You are honoured , we are dishonoured !
46004011	To this very hour we go hungry and thirsty , we are in rags , we are brutally treated , we are homeless .
46004012	We work hard with our own hands . When we are cursed , we bless ; when we are persecuted , we endure it ;
46004013	when we are slandered , we answer kindly . We have become the scum of the earth , the garbage of the world – right up to this moment .
46004014	I am writing this not to shame you but to warn you as my dear children .
46004015	Even if you had ten thousand guardians in Christ , you do not have many fathers , for in Christ Jesus I became your father through the gospel .
46004016	Therefore I urge you to imitate me .
46004017	For this reason I have sent to you Timothy , my son whom I love , who is faithful in the Lord . He will remind you of my way of life in Christ Jesus , which agrees with what I teach everywhere in every church .
46004018	Some of you have become arrogant , as if I were not coming to you .
46004019	But I will come to you very soon , if the Lord is willing , and then I will find out not only how these arrogant people are talking , but what power they have .
46004020	For the kingdom of God is not a matter of talk but of power .
46004021	What do you prefer ? Shall I come to you with a rod of discipline , or shall I come in love and with a gentle spirit ?
46005001	It is actually reported that there is sexual immorality among you , and of a kind that even pagans do not tolerate : a man is sleeping with his father’s wife .
46005002	And you are proud ! Shouldn’t you rather have gone into mourning and have put out of your fellowship the man who has been doing this ?
46005003	For my part , even though I am not physically present , I am with you in spirit . As one who is present with you in this way , I have already passed judgment in the name of our Lord Jesus on the one who has been doing this .
46005004	So when you are assembled and I am with you in spirit , and the power of our Lord Jesus is present ,
46005005	hand this man over to Satan for the destruction of the flesh , , so that his spirit may be saved on the day of the Lord .
46005006	Your boasting is not good . Don’t you know that a little yeast leavens the whole batch of dough ?
46005007	Get rid of the old yeast , so that you may be a new unleavened batch – as you really are . For Christ , our Passover lamb , has been sacrificed .
46005008	Therefore let us keep the Festival , not with the old bread leavened with malice and wickedness , but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth .
46005009	I wrote to you in my letter not to associate with sexually immoral people –
46005010	not at all meaning the people of this world who are immoral , or the greedy and swindlers , or idolaters . In that case you would have to leave this world .
46005011	But now I am writing to you that you must not associate with anyone who claims to be a brother or sister but is sexually immoral or greedy , an idolater or slanderer , a drunkard or swindler . Do not even eat with such people .
46005012	What business is it of mine to judge those outside the church ? Are you not to judge those inside ?
46005013	God will judge those outside . ‘ Expel the wicked person from among you . ’
46006001	If any of you has a dispute with another , do you dare to take it before the ungodly for judgment instead of before the Lord’s people ?
46006002	Or do you not know that the Lord’s people will judge the world ? And if you are to judge the world , are you not competent to judge trivial cases ?
46006003	Do you not know that we will judge angels ? How much more the things of this life !
46006004	Therefore , if you have disputes about such matters , do you ask for a ruling from those whose way of life is scorned in the church ?
46006005	I say this to shame you . Is it possible that there is nobody among you wise enough to judge a dispute between believers ?
46006006	But instead , one brother takes another to court – and this in front of unbelievers !
46006007	The very fact that you have lawsuits among you means you have been completely defeated already . Why not rather be wronged ? Why not rather be cheated ?
46006008	Instead , you yourselves cheat and do wrong , and you do this to your brothers and sisters .
46006009	Or do you not know that wrongdoers will not inherit the kingdom of God ? Do not be deceived : neither the sexually immoral nor idolaters nor adulterers nor men who have sex with men
46006010	nor thieves nor the greedy nor drunkards nor slanderers nor swindlers will inherit the kingdom of God .
46006011	And that is what some of you were . But you were washed , you were sanctified , you were justified in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ and by the Spirit of our God .
46006012	‘ I have the right to do anything , ’ you say – but not everything is beneficial . ‘ I have the right to do anything ’ – but I will not be mastered by anything .
46006013	You say , ‘ Food for the stomach and the stomach for food , and God will destroy them both . ’ The body , however , is not meant for sexual immorality but for the Lord , and the Lord for the body .
46006014	By his power God raised the Lord from the dead , and he will raise us also .
46006015	Do you not know that your bodies are members of Christ himself ? Shall I then take the members of Christ and unite them with a prostitute ? Never !
46006016	Do you not know that he who unites himself with a prostitute is one with her in body ? For it is said , ‘ The two will become one flesh . ’
46006017	But whoever is united with the Lord is one with him in spirit .
46006018	Flee from sexual immorality . All other sins a person commits are outside the body , but whoever sins sexually , sins against their own body .
46006019	Do you not know that your bodies are temples of the Holy Spirit , who is in you , whom you have received from God ? You are not your own ;
46006020	you were bought at a price . Therefore honour God with your bodies .
46007001	Now for the matters you wrote about : ‘ It is good for a man not to have sexual relations with a woman . ’
46007002	But since sexual immorality is occurring , each man should have sexual relations with his own wife , and each woman with her own husband .
46007003	The husband should fulfil his marital duty to his wife , and likewise the wife to her husband .
46007004	The wife does not have authority over her own body but yields it to her husband . In the same way , the husband does not have authority over his own body but yields it to his wife .
46007005	Do not deprive each other except perhaps by mutual consent and for a time , so that you may devote yourselves to prayer . Then come together again so that Satan will not tempt you because of your lack of self-control .
46007006	I say this as a concession , not as a command .
46007007	I wish that all of you were as I am . But each of you has your own gift from God ; one has this gift , another has that .
46007008	Now to the unmarried and the widows I say : it is good for them to stay unmarried , as I do .
46007009	But if they cannot control themselves , they should marry , for it is better to marry than to burn with passion .
46007010	To the married I give this command ( not I , but the Lord ) : a wife must not separate from her husband .
46007011	But if she does , she must remain unmarried or else be reconciled to her husband . And a husband must not divorce his wife .
46007012	To the rest I say this ( I , not the Lord ) : If any brother has a wife who is not a believer and she is willing to live with him , he must not divorce her .
46007013	And if a woman has a husband who is not a believer and he is willing to live with her , she must not divorce him .
46007014	For the unbelieving husband has been sanctified through his wife , and the unbelieving wife has been sanctified through her believing husband . Otherwise your children would be unclean , but as it is , they are holy .
46007015	But if the unbeliever leaves , let it be so . The brother or the sister is not bound in such circumstances ; God has called us to live in peace .
46007016	How do you know , wife , whether you will save your husband ? Or , how do you know , husband , whether you will save your wife ?
46007017	Nevertheless , each person should live as a believer in whatever situation the Lord has assigned to them , just as God has called them . This is the rule I lay down in all the churches .
46007018	Was a man already circumcised when he was called ? He should not become uncircumcised . Was a man uncircumcised when he was called ? He should not be circumcised .
46007019	Circumcision is nothing and uncircumcision is nothing . Keeping God’s commands is what counts .
46007020	Each person should remain in the situation they were in when God called them .
46007021	Were you a slave when you were called ? Don’t let it trouble you – although if you can gain your freedom , do so .
46007022	For the one who was a slave when called to faith in the Lord is the Lord’s freed person ; similarly , the one who was free when called is Christ’s slave .
46007023	You were bought at a price ; do not become slaves of human beings .
46007024	Brothers and sisters , each person , as responsible to God , should remain in the situation they were in when God called them .
46007025	Now about virgins : I have no command from the Lord , but I give a judgment as one who by the Lord’s mercy is trustworthy .
46007026	Because of the present crisis , I think that it is good for a man to remain as he is .
46007027	Are you pledged to a woman ? Do not seek to be released . Are you free from such a commitment ? Do not look for a wife .
46007028	But if you do marry , you have not sinned ; and if a virgin marries , she has not sinned . But those who marry will face many troubles in this life , and I want to spare you this .
46007029	What I mean , brothers and sisters , is that the time is short . From now on those who have wives should live as if they do not ;
46007030	those who mourn , as if they did not ; those who are happy , as if they were not ; those who buy something , as if it were not theirs to keep ;
46007031	those who use the things of the world , as if not engrossed in them . For this world in its present form is passing away .
46007032	I would like you to be free from concern . An unmarried man is concerned about the Lord’s affairs – how he can please the Lord .
46007033	But a married man is concerned about the affairs of this world – how he can please his wife –
46007034	and his interests are divided . An unmarried woman or virgin is concerned about the Lord’s affairs : her aim is to be devoted to the Lord in both body and spirit . But a married woman is concerned about the affairs of this world – how she can please her husband .
46007035	I am saying this for your own good , not to restrict you , but that you may live in a right way in undivided devotion to the Lord .
46007036	If anyone is worried that he might not be acting honourably towards the virgin he is engaged to , and if his passions are too strong and he feels he ought to marry , he should do as he wants . He is not sinning . They should get married .
46007037	But the man who has settled the matter in his own mind , who is under no compulsion but has control over his own will , and who has made up his mind not to marry the virgin – this man also does the right thing .
46007038	So then , he who marries the virgin does right , but he who does not marry her does better .
46007039	A woman is bound to her husband as long as he lives . But if her husband dies , she is free to marry anyone she wishes , but he must belong to the Lord .
46007040	In my judgment , she is happier if she stays as she is – and I think that I too have the Spirit of God .
46008001	Now about food sacrificed to idols : we know that ‘ We all possess knowledge . ’ But knowledge puffs up while love builds up .
46008002	Those who think they know something do not yet know as they ought to know .
46008003	But whoever loves God is known by God .
46008004	So then , about eating food sacrificed to idols : we know that ‘ An idol is nothing at all in the world ’ and that ‘ There is no God but one . ’
46008005	For even if there are so-called gods , whether in heaven or on earth ( as indeed there are many ‘ gods’ and many ‘ lords’ ) ,
46008006	yet for us there is but one God , the Father , from whom all things came and for whom we live ; and there is but one Lord , Jesus Christ , through whom all things came and through whom we live .
46008007	But not everyone possesses this knowledge . Some people are still so accustomed to idols that when they eat sacrificial food they think of it as having been sacrificed to a god , and since their conscience is weak , it is defiled .
46008008	But food does not bring us near to God ; we are no worse if we do not eat , and no better if we do .
46008009	Be careful , however , that the exercise of your rights does not become a stumbling-block to the weak .
46008010	For if someone with a weak conscience sees you , with all your knowledge , eating in an idol’s temple , won’t that person be emboldened to eat what is sacrificed to idols ?
46008011	So this weak brother or sister , for whom Christ died , is destroyed by your knowledge .
46008012	When you sin against them in this way and wound their weak conscience , you sin against Christ .
46008013	Therefore , if what I eat causes my brother or sister to fall into sin , I will never eat meat again , so that I will not cause them to fall .
46009001	Am I not free ? Am I not an apostle ? Have I not seen Jesus our Lord ? Are you not the result of my work in the Lord ?
46009002	Even though I may not be an apostle to others , surely I am to you ! For you are the seal of my apostleship in the Lord .
46009003	This is my defence to those who sit in judgment on me .
46009004	Don’t we have the right to food and drink ?
46009005	Don’t we have the right to take a believing wife along with us , as do the other apostles and the Lord’s brothers and Cephas ?
46009006	Or is it only I and Barnabas who lack the right to not work for a living ?
46009007	Who serves as a soldier at his own expense ? Who plants a vineyard and does not eat its grapes ? Who tends a flock and does not drink the milk ?
46009008	Do I say this merely on human authority ? Doesn’t the Law say the same thing ?
46009009	For it is written in the Law of Moses : ‘ Do not muzzle an ox while it is treading out the grain . ’ Is it about oxen that God is concerned ?
46009010	Surely he says this for us , doesn’t he ? Yes , this was written for us , because whoever ploughs and threshes should be able to do so in the hope of sharing in the harvest .
46009011	If we have sown spiritual seed among you , is it too much if we reap a material harvest from you ?
46009012	If others have this right of support from you , shouldn’t we have it all the more ? But we did not use this right . On the contrary , we put up with anything rather than hinder the gospel of Christ .
46009013	Don’t you know that those who serve in the temple get their food from the temple , and that those who serve at the altar share in what is offered on the altar ?
46009014	In the same way , the Lord has commanded that those who preach the gospel should receive their living from the gospel .
46009015	But I have not used any of these rights . And I am not writing this in the hope that you will do such things for me , for I would rather die than allow anyone to deprive me of this boast .
46009016	For when I preach the gospel , I cannot boast , since I am compelled to preach . Woe to me if I do not preach the gospel !
46009017	If I preach voluntarily , I have a reward ; if not voluntarily , I am simply discharging the trust committed to me .
46009018	What then is my reward ? Just this : that in preaching the gospel I may offer it free of charge , and so not make full use of my rights as a preacher of the gospel .
46009019	Though I am free and belong to no one , I have made myself a slave to everyone , to win as many as possible .
46009020	To the Jews I became like a Jew , to win the Jews . To those under the law I became like one under the law ( though I myself am not under the law ) , so as to win those under the law .
46009021	To those not having the law I became like one not having the law ( though I am not free from God’s law but am under Christ’s law ) , so as to win those not having the law .
46009022	To the weak I became weak , to win the weak . I have become all things to all people so that by all possible means I might save some .
46009023	I do all this for the sake of the gospel , that I may share in its blessings .
46009024	Do you not know that in a race all the runners run , but only one gets the prize ? Run in such a way as to get the prize .
46009025	Everyone who competes in the games goes into strict training . They do it to get a crown that will not last ; but we do it to get a crown that will last for ever .
46009026	Therefore I do not run like someone running aimlessly ; I do not fight like a boxer beating the air .
46009027	No , I strike a blow to my body and make it my slave so that after I have preached to others , I myself will not be disqualified for the prize .
46010001	For I do not want you to be ignorant of the fact , brothers and sisters , that our ancestors were all under the cloud and that they all passed through the sea .
46010002	They were all baptised into Moses in the cloud and in the sea .
46010003	They all ate the same spiritual food
46010004	and drank the same spiritual drink ; for they drank from the spiritual rock that accompanied them , and that rock was Christ .
46010005	Nevertheless , God was not pleased with most of them ; their bodies were scattered in the wilderness .
46010006	Now these things occurred as examples to keep us from setting our hearts on evil things as they did .
46010007	Do not be idolaters , as some of them were ; as it is written : ‘ The people sat down to eat and drink and got up to indulge in revelry . ’
46010008	We should not commit sexual immorality , as some of them did – and in one day twenty-three thousand of them died .
46010009	We should not test Christ , as some of them did – and were killed by snakes .
46010010	And do not grumble , as some of them did – and were killed by the destroying angel .
46010011	These things happened to them as examples and were written down as warnings for us , on whom the culmination of the ages has come .
46010012	So , if you think you are standing firm , be careful that you don’t fall !
46010013	No temptation has overtaken you except what is common to mankind . And God is faithful ; he will not let you be tempted beyond what you can bear . But when you are tempted , he will also provide a way out so that you can endure it .
46010014	Therefore , my dear friends , flee from idolatry .
46010015	I speak to sensible people ; judge for yourselves what I say .
46010016	Is not the cup of thanksgiving for which we give thanks a participation in the blood of Christ ? And is not the bread that we break a participation in the body of Christ ?
46010017	Because there is one loaf , we , who are many , are one body , for we all share the one loaf .
46010018	Consider the people of Israel : do not those who eat the sacrifices participate in the altar ?
46010019	Do I mean then that food sacrificed to an idol is anything , or that an idol is anything ?
46010020	No , but the sacrifices of pagans are offered to demons , not to God , and I do not want you to be participants with demons .
46010021	You cannot drink the cup of the Lord and the cup of demons too ; you cannot have a part in both the Lord’s table and the table of demons .
46010022	Are we trying to arouse the Lord’s jealousy ? Are we stronger than he ?
46010023	‘ I have the right to do anything , ’ you say – but not everything is beneficial . ‘ I have the right to do anything ’ – but not everything is constructive .
46010024	No one should seek their own good , but the good of others .
46010025	Eat anything sold in the meat market without raising questions of conscience ,
46010026	for , ‘ The earth is the Lord’s , and everything in it . ’
46010027	If an unbeliever invites you to a meal and you want to go , eat whatever is put before you without raising questions of conscience .
46010028	But if someone says to you , ‘ This has been offered in sacrifice , ’ then do not eat it , both for the sake of the one who told you and for the sake of conscience .
46010029	I am referring to the other person’s conscience , not yours . For why is my freedom being judged by another’s conscience ?
46010030	If I take part in the meal with thankfulness , why am I denounced because of something I thank God for ?
46010031	So whether you eat or drink or whatever you do , do it all for the glory of God .
46010032	Do not cause anyone to stumble , whether Jews , Greeks or the church of God –
46010033	even as I try to please everyone in every way . For I am not seeking my own good but the good of many , so that they may be saved .
46011001	Follow my example , as I follow the example of Christ .
46011002	I praise you for remembering me in everything and for holding to the traditions just as I passed them on to you .
46011003	But I want you to realise that the head of every man is Christ , and the head of the woman is man , and the head of Christ is God .
46011004	Every man who prays or prophesies with his head covered dishonours his head .
46011005	But every woman who prays or prophesies with her head uncovered dishonours her head – it is the same as having her head shaved .
46011006	For if a woman does not cover her head , she might as well have her hair cut off ; but if it is a disgrace for a woman to have her hair cut off or her head shaved , then she should cover her head .
46011007	A man ought not to cover his head , since he is the image and glory of God ; but woman is the glory of man .
46011008	For man did not come from woman , but woman from man ;
46011009	neither was man created for woman , but woman for man .
46011010	It is for this reason that a woman ought to have authority over her own head , because of the angels .
46011011	Nevertheless , in the Lord woman is not independent of man , nor is man independent of woman .
46011012	For as woman came from man , so also man is born of woman . But everything comes from God .
46011013	Judge for yourselves : is it proper for a woman to pray to God with her head uncovered ?
46011014	Does not the very nature of things teach you that if a man has long hair , it is a disgrace to him ,
46011015	but that if a woman has long hair , it is her glory ? For long hair is given to her as a covering .
46011016	If anyone wants to be contentious about this , we have no other practice – nor do the churches of God .
46011017	In the following directives I have no praise for you , for your meetings do more harm than good .
46011018	In the first place , I hear that when you come together as a church , there are divisions among you , and to some extent I believe it .
46011019	No doubt there have to be differences among you to show which of you have God’s approval .
46011020	So then , when you come together , it is not the Lord’s Supper you eat ,
46011021	for when you are eating , some of you go ahead with your own private suppers . As a result , one person remains hungry and another gets drunk .
46011022	Don’t you have homes to eat and drink in ? Or do you despise the church of God by humiliating those who have nothing ? What shall I say to you ? Shall I praise you ? Certainly not in this matter !
46011023	For I received from the Lord what I also passed on to you : the Lord Jesus , on the night he was betrayed , took bread ,
46011024	and when he had given thanks , he broke it and said , ‘ This is my body , which is for you ; do this in remembrance of me . ’
46011025	In the same way , after supper he took the cup , saying , ‘ This cup is the new covenant in my blood ; do this , whenever you drink it , in remembrance of me . ’
46011026	For whenever you eat this bread and drink this cup , you proclaim the Lord’s death until he comes .
46011027	So then , whoever eats the bread or drinks the cup of the Lord in an unworthy manner will be guilty of sinning against the body and blood of the Lord .
46011028	Everyone ought to examine themselves before they eat of the bread and drink from the cup .
46011029	For those who eat and drink without discerning the body of Christ eat and drink judgment on themselves .
46011030	That is why many among you are weak and ill , and a number of you have fallen asleep .
46011031	But if we were more discerning with regard to ourselves , we would not come under such judgment .
46011032	Nevertheless , when we are judged in this way by the Lord , we are being disciplined so that we will not be finally condemned with the world .
46011033	So then , my brothers and sisters , when you gather to eat , you should all eat together .
46011034	Anyone who is hungry should eat something at home , so that when you meet together it may not result in judgment . And when I come I will give further instructions .
46012001	Now about the gifts of the Spirit , brothers and sisters , I do not want you to be uninformed .
46012002	You know that when you were pagans , somehow or other you were influenced and led astray to dumb idols .
46012003	Therefore I want you to know that no one who is speaking by the Spirit of God says , ‘ Jesus be cursed , ’ and no one can say , ‘ Jesus is Lord , ’ except by the Holy Spirit .
46012004	There are different kinds of gifts , but the same Spirit distributes them .
46012005	There are different kinds of service , but the same Lord .
46012006	There are different kinds of working , but in all of them and in everyone it is the same God at work .
46012007	Now to each one the manifestation of the Spirit is given for the common good .
46012008	To one there is given through the Spirit a message of wisdom , to another a message of knowledge by means of the same Spirit ,
46012009	to another faith by the same Spirit , to another gifts of healing by that one Spirit ,
46012010	to another miraculous powers , to another prophecy , to another distinguishing between spirits , to another speaking in different kinds of tongues , and to still another the interpretation of tongues .
46012011	All these are the work of one and the same Spirit , and he distributes them to each one , just as he determines .
46012012	Just as a body , though one , has many parts , but all its many parts form one body , so it is with Christ .
46012013	For we were all baptised by one Spirit so as to form one body – whether Jews or Gentiles , slave or free – and we were all given the one Spirit to drink .
46012014	And so the body is not made up of one part but of many .
46012015	Now if the foot should say , ‘ Because I am not a hand , I do not belong to the body , ’ it would not for that reason stop being part of the body .
46012016	And if the ear should say , ‘ Because I am not an eye , I do not belong to the body , ’ it would not for that reason stop being part of the body .
46012017	If the whole body were an eye , where would the sense of hearing be ? If the whole body were an ear , where would the sense of smell be ?
46012018	But in fact God has placed the parts in the body , every one of them , just as he wanted them to be .
46012019	If they were all one part , where would the body be ?
46012020	As it is , there are many parts , but one body .
46012021	The eye cannot say to the hand , ‘ I don’t need you ! ’ And the head cannot say to the feet , ‘ I don’t need you ! ’
46012022	On the contrary , those parts of the body that seem to be weaker are indispensable ,
46012023	and the parts that we think are less honourable we treat with special honour . And the parts that are unpresentable are treated with special modesty ,
46012024	while our presentable parts need no special treatment . But God has put the body together , giving greater honour to the parts that lacked it ,
46012025	so that there should be no division in the body , but that its parts should have equal concern for each other .
46012026	If one part suffers , every part suffers with it ; if one part is honoured , every part rejoices with it .
46012027	Now you are the body of Christ , and each one of you is a part of it .
46012028	And God has placed in the church first of all apostles , second prophets , third teachers , then miracles , then gifts of healing , of helping , of guidance , and of different kinds of tongues .
46012029	Are all apostles ? Are all prophets ? Are all teachers ? Do all work miracles ?
46012030	Do all have gifts of healing ? Do all speak in tongues ? Do all interpret ?
46012031	Now eagerly desire the greater gifts . And yet I will show you the most excellent way .
46013001	If I speak in the tongues of men or of angels , but do not have love , I am only a resounding gong or a clanging cymbal .
46013002	If I have the gift of prophecy and can fathom all mysteries and all knowledge , and if I have a faith that can move mountains , but do not have love , I am nothing .
46013003	If I give all I possess to the poor and give over my body to hardship that I may boast , but do not have love , I gain nothing .
46013004	Love is patient , love is kind . It does not envy , it does not boast , it is not proud .
46013005	It does not dishonour others , it is not self-seeking , it is not easily angered , it keeps no record of wrongs .
46013006	Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth .
46013007	It always protects , always trusts , always hopes , always perseveres .
46013008	Love never fails . But where there are prophecies , they will cease ; where there are tongues , they will be stilled ; where there is knowledge , it will pass away .
46013009	For we know in part and we prophesy in part ,
46013010	but when completeness comes , what is in part disappears .
46013011	When I was a child , I talked like a child , I thought like a child , I reasoned like a child . When I became a man , I put the ways of childhood behind me .
46013012	For now we see only a reflection as in a mirror ; then we shall see face to face . Now I know in part ; then I shall know fully , even as I am fully known .
46013013	And now these three remain : faith , hope and love . But the greatest of these is love .
46014001	Follow the way of love and eagerly desire gifts of the Spirit , especially prophecy .
46014002	For anyone who speaks in a tongue does not speak to people but to God . Indeed , no one understands them ; they utter mysteries by the Spirit .
46014003	But the one who prophesies speaks to people for their strengthening , encouraging and comfort .
46014004	Anyone who speaks in a tongue edifies themselves , but the one who prophesies edifies the church .
46014005	I would like every one of you to speak in tongues , but even more to prophesy . The one who prophesies is greater than the one who speaks in tongues , unless someone interprets , so that the church may be edified .
46014006	Now , brothers and sisters , if I come to you and speak in tongues , what good will I be to you , unless I bring you some revelation or knowledge or prophecy or word of instruction ?
46014007	Even in the case of lifeless things that make sounds , such as the pipe or harp , how will anyone know what tune is being played unless there is a distinction in the notes ?
46014008	Again , if the trumpet does not sound a clear call , who will get ready for battle ?
46014009	So it is with you . Unless you speak intelligible words with your tongue , how will anyone know what you are saying ? You will just be speaking into the air .
46014010	Undoubtedly there are all sorts of languages in the world , yet none of them is without meaning .
46014011	If then I do not grasp the meaning of what someone is saying , I am a foreigner to the speaker , and the speaker is a foreigner to me .
46014012	So it is with you . Since you are eager for gifts of the Spirit , try to excel in those that build up the church .
46014013	For this reason the one who speaks in a tongue should pray that they may interpret what they say .
46014014	For if I pray in a tongue , my spirit prays , but my mind is unfruitful .
46014015	So what shall I do ? I will pray with my spirit , but I will also pray with my understanding ; I will sing with my spirit , but I will also sing with my understanding .
46014016	Otherwise when you are praising God in the Spirit , how can someone else , who is now put in the position of an enquirer , say ‘ Amen ’ to your thanksgiving , since they do not know what you are saying ?
46014017	You are giving thanks well enough , but no one else is edified .
46014018	I thank God that I speak in tongues more than all of you .
46014019	But in the church I would rather speak five intelligible words to instruct others than ten thousand words in a tongue .
46014020	Brothers and sisters , stop thinking like children . In regard to evil be infants , but in your thinking be adults .
46014021	In the Law it is written : ‘ With other tongues and through the lips of foreigners I will speak to this people , but even then they will not listen to me ,
46014022	Tongues , then , are a sign , not for believers but for unbelievers ; prophecy , however , is not for unbelievers but for believers .
46014023	So if the whole church comes together and everyone speaks in tongues , and enquirers or unbelievers come in , will they not say that you are out of your mind ?
46014024	But if an unbeliever or an enquirer comes in while everyone is prophesying , they are convicted of sin and are brought under judgment by all ,
46014025	as the secrets of their hearts are laid bare . So they will fall down and worship God , exclaiming , ‘ God is really among you ! ’
46014026	What then shall we say , brothers and sisters ? When you come together , each of you has a hymn , or a word of instruction , a revelation , a tongue or an interpretation . Everything must be done so that the church may be built up .
46014027	If anyone speaks in a tongue , two – or at the most three – should speak , one at a time , and someone must interpret .
46014028	If there is no interpreter , the speaker should keep quiet in the church and speak to himself and to God .
46014029	Two or three prophets should speak , and the others should weigh carefully what is said .
46014030	And if a revelation comes to someone who is sitting down , the first speaker should stop .
46014031	For you can all prophesy in turn so that everyone may be instructed and encouraged .
46014032	The spirits of prophets are subject to the control of prophets .
46014033	For God is not a God of disorder but of peace – as in all the congregations of the Lord’s people .
46014034	Women should remain silent in the churches . They are not allowed to speak , but must be in submission , as the law says .
46014035	If they want to enquire about something , they should ask their own husbands at home ; for it is disgraceful for a woman to speak in the church .
46014036	Or did the word of God originate with you ? Or are you the only people it has reached ?
46014037	If anyone thinks they are a prophet or otherwise gifted by the Spirit , let them acknowledge that what I am writing to you is the Lord’s command .
46014038	But if anyone ignores this , they will themselves be ignored .
46014039	Therefore , my brothers and sisters , be eager to prophesy , and do not forbid speaking in tongues .
46014040	But everything should be done in a fitting and orderly way .
46015001	Now , brothers and sisters , I want to remind you of the gospel I preached to you , which you received and on which you have taken your stand .
46015002	By this gospel you are saved , if you hold firmly to the word I preached to you . Otherwise , you have believed in vain .
46015003	For what I received I passed on to you as of first importance : that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures ,
46015004	that he was buried , that he was raised on the third day according to the Scriptures ,
46015005	and that he appeared to Cephas , and then to the Twelve .
46015006	After that , he appeared to more than five hundred of the brothers and sisters at the same time , most of whom are still living , though some have fallen asleep .
46015007	Then he appeared to James , then to all the apostles ,
46015008	and last of all he appeared to me also , as to one abnormally born .
46015009	For I am the least of the apostles and do not even deserve to be called an apostle , because I persecuted the church of God .
46015010	But by the grace of God I am what I am , and his grace to me was not without effect . No , I worked harder than all of them – yet not I , but the grace of God that was with me .
46015011	Whether , then , it is I or they , this is what we preach , and this is what you believed .
46015012	But if it is preached that Christ has been raised from the dead , how can some of you say that there is no resurrection of the dead ?
46015013	If there is no resurrection of the dead , then not even Christ has been raised .
46015014	And if Christ has not been raised , our preaching is useless and so is your faith .
46015015	More than that , we are then found to be false witnesses about God , for we have testified about God that he raised Christ from the dead . But he did not raise him if in fact the dead are not raised .
46015016	For if the dead are not raised , then Christ has not been raised either .
46015017	And if Christ has not been raised , your faith is futile ; you are still in your sins .
46015018	Then those also who have fallen asleep in Christ are lost .
46015019	If only for this life we have hope in Christ , we are of all people most to be pitied .
46015020	But Christ has indeed been raised from the dead , the firstfruits of those who have fallen asleep .
46015021	For since death came through a man , the resurrection of the dead comes also through a man .
46015022	For as in Adam all die , so in Christ all will be made alive .
46015023	But each in turn : Christ , the firstfruits ; then , when he comes , those who belong to him .
46015024	Then the end will come , when he hands over the kingdom to God the Father after he has destroyed all dominion , authority and power .
46015025	For he must reign until he has put all his enemies under his feet .
46015026	The last enemy to be destroyed is death .
46015027	For he ‘ has put everything under his feet ’ . Now when it says that ‘ everything ’ has been put under him , it is clear that this does not include God himself , who put everything under Christ .
46015028	When he has done this , then the Son himself will be made subject to him who put everything under him , so that God may be all in all .
46015029	Now if there is no resurrection , what will those do who are baptised for the dead ? If the dead are not raised at all , why are people baptised for them ?
46015030	And as for us , why do we endanger ourselves every hour ?
46015031	I face death every day – yes , just as surely as I boast about you in Christ Jesus our Lord .
46015032	If I fought wild beasts in Ephesus with no more than human hopes , what have I gained ? If the dead are not raised , ‘ Let us eat and drink , for tomorrow we die . ’
46015035	But someone will ask , ‘ How are the dead raised ? With what kind of body will they come ? ’
46015036	How foolish ! What you sow does not come to life unless it dies .
46015037	When you sow , you do not plant the body that will be , but just a seed , perhaps of wheat or of something else .
46015038	But God gives it a body as he has determined , and to each kind of seed he gives its own body .
46015039	Not all flesh is the same : people have one kind of flesh , animals have another , birds another and fish another .
46015040	There are also heavenly bodies and there are earthly bodies ; but the splendour of the heavenly bodies is one kind , and the splendour of the earthly bodies is another .
46015041	The sun has one kind of splendour , the moon another and the stars another ; and star differs from star in splendour .
46015042	So will it be with the resurrection of the dead . The body that is sown is perishable , it is raised imperishable ;
46015043	it is sown in dishonour , it is raised in glory ; it is sown in weakness , it is raised in power ;
46015044	it is sown a natural body , it is raised a spiritual body . If there is a natural body , there is also a spiritual body .
46015045	So it is written : ‘ The first man Adam became a living being ’ ; the last Adam , a life-giving spirit .
46015046	The spiritual did not come first , but the natural , and after that the spiritual .
46015047	The first man was of the dust of the earth ; the second man is of heaven .
46015048	As was the earthly man , so are those who are of the earth ; and as is the heavenly man , so also are those who are of heaven .
46015049	And just as we have borne the image of the earthly man , so shall we bear the image of the heavenly man .
46015050	I declare to you , brothers and sisters , that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God , nor does the perishable inherit the imperishable .
46015051	Listen , I tell you a mystery : we will not all sleep , but we will all be changed –
46015052	in a flash , in the twinkling of an eye , at the last trumpet . For the trumpet will sound , the dead will be raised imperishable , and we will be changed .
46015053	For the perishable must clothe itself with the imperishable , and the mortal with immortality .
46015054	When the perishable has been clothed with the imperishable , and the mortal with immortality , then the saying that is written will come true : ‘ Death has been swallowed up in victory . ’
46015055	‘ Where , O death , is your victory ? Where , O death , is your sting ? ’
46015058	Therefore , my dear brothers and sisters , stand firm . Let nothing move you . Always give yourselves fully to the work of the Lord , because you know that your labour in the Lord is not in vain .
46016001	Now about the collection for the Lord’s people : do what I told the Galatian churches to do .
46016002	On the first day of every week , each one of you should set aside a sum of money in keeping with your income , saving it up , so that when I come no collections will have to be made .
46016003	Then , when I arrive , I will give letters of introduction to the men you approve and send them with your gift to Jerusalem .
46016004	If it seems advisable for me to go also , they will accompany me .
46016005	After I go through Macedonia , I will come to you – for I will be going through Macedonia .
46016006	Perhaps I will stay with you for a while , or even spend the winter , so that you can help me on my journey , wherever I go .
46016007	For I do not want to see you now and make only a passing visit ; I hope to spend some time with you , if the Lord permits .
46016008	But I will stay on at Ephesus until Pentecost ,
46016009	because a great door for effective work has opened to me , and there are many who oppose me .
46016010	When Timothy comes , see to it that he has nothing to fear while he is with you , for he is carrying on the work of the Lord , just as I am .
46016011	No one , then , should treat him with contempt . Send him on his way in peace so that he may return to me . I am expecting him along with the brothers .
46016012	Now about our brother Apollos : I strongly urged him to go to you with the brothers . He was quite unwilling to go now , but he will go when he has the opportunity .
46016013	Be on your guard ; stand firm in the faith ; be courageous ; be strong .
46016014	Do everything in love .
46016015	You know that the household of Stephanas were the first converts in Achaia , and they have devoted themselves to the service of the Lord’s people . I urge you , brothers and sisters ,
46016016	to submit to such people and to everyone who joins in the work and labours at it .
46016017	I was glad when Stephanas , Fortunatus and Achaicus arrived , because they have supplied what was lacking from you .
46016018	For they refreshed my spirit and yours also . Such men deserve recognition .
46016019	The churches in the province of Asia send you greetings . Aquila and Priscilla greet you warmly in the Lord , and so does the church that meets at their house .
46016020	All the brothers and sisters here send you greetings . Greet one another with a holy kiss .
46016021	I , Paul , write this greeting in my own hand .
46016022	If anyone does not love the Lord , let that person be cursed ! Come , Lord !
46016023	The grace of the Lord Jesus be with you .
46016024	My love to all of you in Christ Jesus . Amen .
47001001	Paul , an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God , and Timothy our brother , To the church of God in Corinth , together with all his holy people throughout Achaia :
47001002	Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
47001003	Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ , the Father of compassion and the God of all comfort ,
47001004	who comforts us in all our troubles , so that we can comfort those in any trouble with the comfort we ourselves receive from God .
47001005	For just as we share abundantly in the sufferings of Christ , so also our comfort abounds through Christ .
47001006	If we are distressed , it is for your comfort and salvation ; if we are comforted , it is for your comfort , which produces in you patient endurance of the same sufferings we suffer .
47001007	And our hope for you is firm , because we know that just as you share in our sufferings , so also you share in our comfort .
47001008	We do not want you to be uninformed , brothers and sisters , about the troubles we experienced in the province of Asia . We were under great pressure , far beyond our ability to endure , so that we despaired of life itself .
47001009	Indeed , we felt we had received the sentence of death . But this happened that we might not rely on ourselves but on God , who raises the dead .
47001010	He has delivered us from such a deadly peril , and he will deliver us again . On him we have set our hope that he will continue to deliver us ,
47001011	as you help us by your prayers . Then many will give thanks on our behalf for the gracious favour granted us in answer to the prayers of many .
47001012	Now this is our boast : our conscience testifies that we have conducted ourselves in the world , and especially in our relations with you , with integrity and godly sincerity . We have done so , relying not on worldly wisdom but on God’s grace .
47001013	For we do not write to you anything you cannot read or understand . And I hope that ,
47001014	as you have understood us in part , you will come to understand fully that you can boast of us just as we will boast of you in the day of the Lord Jesus .
47001015	Because I was confident of this , I wanted to visit you first so that you might benefit twice .
47001016	I wanted to visit you on my way to Macedonia and to come back to you from Macedonia , and then to let you send me on my way to Judea .
47001017	Was I fickle when I intended to do this ? Or do I make my plans in a worldly manner so that in the same breath I say both ‘ Yes , yes’ and ‘ No , no’ ?
47001018	But as surely as God is faithful , our message to you is not ‘ Yes’ and ‘ No’ .
47001019	For the Son of God , Jesus Christ , who was preached among you by us – by me , Silas and Timothy – was not ‘ Yes’ and ‘ No’ , but in him it has always been ‘ Yes’ .
47001020	For no matter how many promises God has made , they are ‘ Yes’ in Christ . And so through him the ‘ Amen ’ is spoken by us to the glory of God .
47001021	Now it is God who makes both us and you stand firm in Christ . He anointed us ,
47001022	set his seal of ownership on us , and put his Spirit in our hearts as a deposit , guaranteeing what is to come .
47001023	I call God as my witness – and I stake my life on it – that it was in order to spare you that I did not return to Corinth .
47001024	Not that we lord it over your faith , but we work with you for your joy , because it is by faith you stand firm .
47002001	So I made up my mind that I would not make another painful visit to you .
47002002	For if I grieve you , who is left to make me glad but you whom I have grieved ?
47002003	I wrote as I did , so that when I came I would not be distressed by those who should have made me rejoice . I had confidence in all of you , that you would all share my joy .
47002004	For I wrote to you out of great distress and anguish of heart and with many tears , not to grieve you but to let you know the depth of my love for you .
47002005	If anyone has caused grief , he has not so much grieved me as he has grieved all of you to some extent – not to put it too severely .
47002006	The punishment inflicted on him by the majority is sufficient .
47002007	Now instead , you ought to forgive and comfort him , so that he will not be overwhelmed by excessive sorrow .
47002008	I urge you , therefore , to reaffirm your love for him .
47002009	Another reason I wrote to you was to see if you would stand the test and be obedient in everything .
47002010	Anyone you forgive , I also forgive . And what I have forgiven – if there was anything to forgive – I have forgiven in the sight of Christ for your sake ,
47002011	in order that Satan might not outwit us . For we are not unaware of his schemes .
47002012	Now when I went to Troas to preach the gospel of Christ and found that the Lord had opened a door for me ,
47002013	I still had no peace of mind , because I did not find my brother Titus there . So I said goodbye to them and went on to Macedonia .
47002014	But thanks be to God , who always leads us as captives in Christ’s triumphal procession and uses us to spread the aroma of the knowledge of him everywhere .
47002015	For we are to God the pleasing aroma of Christ among those who are being saved and those who are perishing .
47002016	To the one we are an aroma that brings death ; to the other , an aroma that brings life . And who is equal to such a task ?
47002017	Unlike so many , we do not peddle the word of God for profit . On the contrary , in Christ we speak before God with sincerity , as those sent from God .
47003001	Are we beginning to commend ourselves again ? Or do we need , like some people , letters of recommendation to you or from you ?
47003002	You yourselves are our letter , written on our hearts , known and read by everyone .
47003003	You show that you are a letter from Christ , the result of our ministry , written not with ink but with the Spirit of the living God , not on tablets of stone but on tablets of human hearts .
47003004	Such confidence we have through Christ before God .
47003005	Not that we are competent in ourselves to claim anything for ourselves , but our competence comes from God .
47003006	He has made us competent as ministers of a new covenant – not of the letter but of the Spirit ; for the letter kills , but the Spirit gives life .
47003007	Now if the ministry that brought death , which was engraved in letters on stone , came with glory , so that the Israelites could not look steadily at the face of Moses because of its glory , transitory though it was ,
47003008	will not the ministry of the Spirit be even more glorious ?
47003009	If the ministry that brought condemnation was glorious , how much more glorious is the ministry that brings righteousness !
47003010	For what was glorious has no glory now in comparison with the surpassing glory .
47003011	And if what was transitory came with glory , how much greater is the glory of that which lasts !
47003012	Therefore , since we have such a hope , we are very bold .
47003013	We are not like Moses , who would put a veil over his face to prevent the Israelites from seeing the end of what was passing away .
47003014	But their minds were made dull , for to this day the same veil remains when the old covenant is read . It has not been removed , because only in Christ is it taken away .
47003015	Even to this day when Moses is read , a veil covers their hearts .
47003016	But whenever anyone turns to the Lord , the veil is taken away .
47003017	Now the Lord is the Spirit , and where the Spirit of the Lord is , there is freedom .
47003018	And we all , who with unveiled faces contemplate the Lord’s glory , are being transformed into his image with ever-increasing glory , which comes from the Lord , who is the Spirit .
47004001	Therefore , since through God’s mercy we have this ministry , we do not lose heart .
47004002	Rather , we have renounced secret and shameful ways ; we do not use deception , nor do we distort the word of God . On the contrary , by setting forth the truth plainly we commend ourselves to everyone’s conscience in the sight of God .
47004003	And even if our gospel is veiled , it is veiled to those who are perishing .
47004004	The god of this age has blinded the minds of unbelievers , so that they cannot see the light of the gospel that displays the glory of Christ , who is the image of God .
47004005	For what we preach is not ourselves , but Jesus Christ as Lord , and ourselves as your servants for Jesus’ sake .
47004006	For God , who said , ‘ Let light shine out of darkness , ’ made his light shine in our hearts to give us the light of the knowledge of God’s glory displayed in the face of Christ .
47004007	But we have this treasure in jars of clay to show that this all-surpassing power is from God and not from us .
47004008	We are hard pressed on every side , but not crushed ; perplexed , but not in despair ;
47004009	persecuted , but not abandoned ; struck down , but not destroyed .
47004010	We always carry around in our body the death of Jesus , so that the life of Jesus may also be revealed in our body .
47004011	For we who are alive are always being given over to death for Jesus’ sake , so that his life may also be revealed in our mortal body .
47004012	So then , death is at work in us , but life is at work in you .
47004013	It is written : ‘ I believed ; therefore I have spoken . ’ Since we have that same spirit of faith , we also believe and therefore speak ,
47004014	because we know that the one who raised the Lord Jesus from the dead will also raise us with Jesus and present us with you to himself .
47004015	All this is for your benefit , so that the grace that is reaching more and more people may cause thanksgiving to overflow to the glory of God .
47004016	Therefore we do not lose heart . Though outwardly we are wasting away , yet inwardly we are being renewed day by day .
47004017	For our light and momentary troubles are achieving for us an eternal glory that far outweighs them all .
47004018	So we fix our eyes not on what is seen , but on what is unseen , since what is seen is temporary , but what is unseen is eternal .
47005001	For we know that if the earthly tent we live in is destroyed , we have a building from God , an eternal house in heaven , not built by human hands .
47005002	Meanwhile we groan , longing to be clothed instead with our heavenly dwelling ,
47005003	because when we are clothed , we will not be found naked .
47005004	For while we are in this tent , we groan and are burdened , because we do not wish to be unclothed but to be clothed instead with our heavenly dwelling , so that what is mortal may be swallowed up by life .
47005005	Now the one who has fashioned us for this very purpose is God , who has given us the Spirit as a deposit , guaranteeing what is to come .
47005006	Therefore we are always confident and know that as long as we are at home in the body we are away from the Lord .
47005007	For we live by faith , not by sight .
47005008	We are confident , I say , and would prefer to be away from the body and at home with the Lord .
47005009	So we make it our goal to please him , whether we are at home in the body or away from it .
47005010	For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ , so that each of us may receive what is due to us for the things done while in the body , whether good or bad .
47005011	Since , then , we know what it is to fear the Lord , we try to persuade others . What we are is plain to God , and I hope it is also plain to your conscience .
47005012	We are not trying to commend ourselves to you again , but are giving you an opportunity to take pride in us , so that you can answer those who take pride in what is seen rather than in what is in the heart .
47005013	If we are ‘ out of our mind , ’ as some say , it is for God ; if we are in our right mind , it is for you .
47005014	For Christ’s love compels us , because we are convinced that one died for all , and therefore all died .
47005015	And he died for all , that those who live should no longer live for themselves but for him who died for them and was raised again .
47005016	So from now on we regard no one from a worldly point of view . Though we once regarded Christ in this way , we do so no longer .
47005017	Therefore , if anyone is in Christ , the new creation has come : the old has gone , the new is here !
47005018	All this is from God , who reconciled us to himself through Christ and gave us the ministry of reconciliation :
47005019	that God was reconciling the world to himself in Christ , not counting people’s sins against them . And he has committed to us the message of reconciliation .
47005020	We are therefore Christ’s ambassadors , as though God were making his appeal through us . We implore you on Christ’s behalf : be reconciled to God .
47005021	God made him who had no sin to be sin for us , so that in him we might become the righteousness of God .
47006001	As God’s fellow workers we urge you not to receive God’s grace in vain .
47006002	For he says , ‘ In the time of my favour I heard you , and in the day of salvation I helped you . ’
47006003	We put no stumbling-block in anyone’s path , so that our ministry will not be discredited .
47006004	Rather , as servants of God we commend ourselves in every way : in great endurance ; in troubles , hardships and distresses ;
47006005	in beatings , imprisonments and riots ; in hard work , sleepless nights and hunger ;
47006006	in purity , understanding , patience and kindness ; in the Holy Spirit and in sincere love ;
47006007	in truthful speech and in the power of God ; with weapons of righteousness in the right hand and in the left ;
47006008	through glory and dishonour , bad report and good report ; genuine , yet regarded as impostors ;
47006009	known , yet regarded as unknown ; dying , and yet we live on ; beaten , and yet not killed ;
47006010	sorrowful , yet always rejoicing ; poor , yet making many rich ; having nothing , and yet possessing everything .
47006011	We have spoken freely to you , Corinthians , and opened wide our hearts to you .
47006012	We are not withholding our affection from you , but you are withholding yours from us .
47006013	As a fair exchange – I speak as to my children – open wide your hearts also .
47006014	Do not be yoked together with unbelievers . For what do righteousness and wickedness have in common ? Or what fellowship can light have with darkness ?
47006015	What harmony is there between Christ and Belial ? Or what does a believer have in common with an unbeliever ?
47006016	What agreement is there between the temple of God and idols ? For we are the temple of the living God . As God has said : ‘ I will live with them and walk among them , and I will be their God , and they will be my people . ’ ‘ Come out from them and be separate , Touch no unclean thing , and I will receive you . ’ ‘ I will be a Father to you , and you will be my sons and daughters ,
47007001	Therefore , since we have these promises , dear friends , let us purify ourselves from everything that contaminates body and spirit , perfecting holiness out of reverence for God .
47007002	Make room for us in your hearts . We have wronged no one , we have corrupted no one , we have exploited no one .
47007003	I do not say this to condemn you ; I have said before that you have such a place in our hearts that we would live or die with you .
47007004	I have spoken to you with great frankness ; I take great pride in you . I am greatly encouraged ; in all our troubles my joy knows no bounds .
47007005	For when we came into Macedonia , we had no rest , but we were harassed at every turn – conflicts on the outside , fears within .
47007006	But God , who comforts the downcast , comforted us by the coming of Titus ,
47007007	and not only by his coming but also by the comfort you had given him . He told us about your longing for me , your deep sorrow , your ardent concern for me , so that my joy was greater than ever .
47007008	Even if I caused you sorrow by my letter , I do not regret it . Though I did regret it – I see that my letter hurt you , but only for a little while –
47007009	yet now I am happy , not because you were made sorry , but because your sorrow led you to repentance . For you became sorrowful as God intended and so were not harmed in any way by us .
47007010	Godly sorrow brings repentance that leads to salvation and leaves no regret , but worldly sorrow brings death .
47007011	See what this godly sorrow has produced in you : what earnestness , what eagerness to clear yourselves , what indignation , what alarm , what longing , what concern , what readiness to see justice done . At every point you have proved yourselves to be innocent in this matter .
47007012	So even though I wrote to you , it was neither on account of the one who did the wrong nor on account of the injured party , but rather that before God you could see for yourselves how devoted to us you are .
47007013	By all this we are encouraged . In addition to our own encouragement , we were especially delighted to see how happy Titus was , because his spirit has been refreshed by all of you .
47007014	I had boasted to him about you , and you have not embarrassed me . But just as everything we said to you was true , so our boasting about you to Titus has proved to be true as well .
47007015	And his affection for you is all the greater when he remembers that you were all obedient , receiving him with fear and trembling .
47007016	I am glad I can have complete confidence in you .
47008001	And now , brothers and sisters , we want you to know about the grace that God has given the Macedonian churches .
47008002	In the midst of a very severe trial , their overflowing joy and their extreme poverty welled up in rich generosity .
47008003	For I testify that they gave as much as they were able , and even beyond their ability . Entirely on their own ,
47008004	they urgently pleaded with us for the privilege of sharing in this service to the Lord’s people .
47008005	And they exceeded our expectations : they gave themselves first of all to the Lord , and then by the will of God also to us .
47008006	So we urged Titus , just as he had earlier made a beginning , to bring also to completion this act of grace on your part .
47008007	But since you excel in everything – in faith , in speech , in knowledge , in complete earnestness and in the love we have kindled in you – see that you also excel in this grace of giving .
47008008	I am not commanding you , but I want to test the sincerity of your love by comparing it with the earnestness of others .
47008009	For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ , that though he was rich , yet for your sake he became poor , so that you through his poverty might become rich .
47008010	And here is my judgment about what is best for you in this matter . Last year you were the first not only to give but also to have the desire to do so .
47008011	Now finish the work , so that your eager willingness to do it may be matched by your completion of it , according to your means .
47008012	For if the willingness is there , the gift is acceptable according to what one has , not according to what one does not have .
47008013	Our desire is not that others might be relieved while you are hard pressed , but that there might be equality .
47008014	At the present time your plenty will supply what they need , so that in turn their plenty will supply what you need . The goal is equality ,
47008015	as it is written : ‘ The one who gathered much did not have too much , and the one who gathered little did not have too little . ’
47008016	Thanks be to God , who put into the heart of Titus the same concern I have for you .
47008017	For Titus not only welcomed our appeal , but he is coming to you with much enthusiasm and on his own initiative .
47008018	And we are sending along with him the brother who is praised by all the churches for his service to the gospel .
47008019	What is more , he was chosen by the churches to accompany us as we carry the offering , which we administer in order to honour the Lord himself and to show our eagerness to help .
47008020	We want to avoid any criticism of the way we administer this liberal gift .
47008021	For we are taking pains to do what is right , not only in the eyes of the Lord but also in the eyes of man .
47008022	In addition , we are sending with them our brother who has often proved to us in many ways that he is zealous , and now even more so because of his great confidence in you .
47008023	As for Titus , he is my partner and fellow worker among you ; as for our brothers , they are representatives of the churches and an honour to Christ .
47008024	Therefore show these men the proof of your love and the reason for our pride in you , so that the churches can see it .
47009001	There is no need for me to write to you about this service to the Lord’s people .
47009002	For I know your eagerness to help , and I have been boasting about it to the Macedonians , telling them that since last year you in Achaia were ready to give ; and your enthusiasm has stirred most of them to action .
47009003	But I am sending the brothers in order that our boasting about you in this matter should not prove hollow , but that you may be ready , as I said you would be .
47009004	For if any Macedonians come with me and find you unprepared , we – not to say anything about you – would be ashamed of having been so confident .
47009005	So I thought it necessary to urge the brothers to visit you in advance and finish the arrangements for the generous gift you had promised . Then it will be ready as a generous gift , not as one grudgingly given .
47009006	Remember this : whoever sows sparingly will also reap sparingly , and whoever sows generously will also reap generously .
47009007	Each of you should give what you have decided in your heart to give , not reluctantly or under compulsion , for God loves a cheerful giver .
47009008	And God is able to bless you abundantly , so that in all things at all times , having all that you need , you will abound in every good work .
47009009	As it is written : ‘ They have freely scattered their gifts to the poor ; their righteousness endures for ever . ’
47009012	This service that you perform is not only supplying the needs of the Lord’s people but is also overflowing in many expressions of thanks to God .
47009013	Because of the service by which you have proved yourselves , others will praise God for the obedience that accompanies your confession of the gospel of Christ , and for your generosity in sharing with them and with everyone else .
47009014	And in their prayers for you their hearts will go out to you , because of the surpassing grace God has given you .
47009015	Thanks be to God for his indescribable gift !
47010001	By the humility and gentleness of Christ , I appeal to you – I , Paul , who am ‘ timid ’ when face to face with you , but ‘ bold ’ towards you when away !
47010002	I beg you that when I come I may not have to be as bold as I expect to be towards some people who think that we live by the standards of this world .
47010003	For though we live in the world , we do not wage war as the world does .
47010004	The weapons we fight with are not the weapons of the world . On the contrary , they have divine power to demolish strongholds .
47010005	We demolish arguments and every pretension that sets itself up against the knowledge of God , and we take captive every thought to make it obedient to Christ .
47010006	And we will be ready to punish every act of disobedience , once your obedience is complete .
47010007	You are judging by appearances . If anyone is confident that they belong to Christ , they should consider again that we belong to Christ just as much as they do .
47010008	So even if I boast somewhat freely about the authority the Lord gave us for building you up rather than tearing you down , I will not be ashamed of it .
47010009	I do not want to seem to be trying to frighten you with my letters .
47010010	For some say , ‘ His letters are weighty and forceful , but in person he is unimpressive and his speaking amounts to nothing . ’
47010011	Such people should realise that what we are in our letters when we are absent , we will be in our actions when we are present .
47010012	We do not dare to classify or compare ourselves with some who commend themselves . When they measure themselves by themselves and compare themselves with themselves , they are not wise .
47010013	We , however , will not boast beyond proper limits , but will confine our boasting to the sphere of service God himself has assigned to us , a sphere that also includes you .
47010014	We are not going too far in our boasting , as would be the case if we had not come to you , for we did get as far as you with the gospel of Christ .
47010015	Neither do we go beyond our limits by boasting of work done by others . Our hope is that , as your faith continues to grow , our sphere of activity among you will greatly expand ,
47010016	so that we can preach the gospel in the regions beyond you . For we do not want to boast about work already done in someone else’s territory .
47010017	But , ‘ Let the one who boasts boast in the Lord . ’
47010018	For it is not the one who commends himself who is approved , but the one whom the Lord commends .
47011001	I hope you will put up with me in a little foolishness . Yes , please put up with me !
47011002	I am jealous for you with a godly jealousy . I promised you to one husband , to Christ , so that I might present you as a pure virgin to him .
47011003	But I am afraid that just as Eve was deceived by the snake’s cunning , your minds may somehow be led astray from your sincere and pure devotion to Christ .
47011004	For if someone comes to you and preaches a Jesus other than the Jesus we preached , or if you receive a different spirit from the Spirit you received , or a different gospel from the one you accepted , you put up with it easily enough .
47011005	I do not think I am in the least inferior to those ‘ super-apostles’ .
47011006	I may indeed be untrained as a speaker , but I do have knowledge . We have made this perfectly clear to you in every way .
47011007	Was it a sin for me to lower myself in order to elevate you by preaching the gospel of God to you free of charge ?
47011008	I robbed other churches by receiving support from them so as to serve you .
47011009	And when I was with you and needed something , I was not a burden to anyone , for the brothers who came from Macedonia supplied what I needed . I have kept myself from being a burden to you in any way , and will continue to do so .
47011010	As surely as the truth of Christ is in me , nobody in the regions of Achaia will stop this boasting of mine .
47011011	Why ? Because I do not love you ? God knows I do !
47011012	And I will keep on doing what I am doing in order to cut the ground from under those who want an opportunity to be considered equal with us in the things they boast about .
47011013	For such people are false apostles , deceitful workers , masquerading as apostles of Christ .
47011014	And no wonder , for Satan himself masquerades as an angel of light .
47011015	It is not surprising , then , if his servants also masquerade as servants of righteousness . Their end will be what their actions deserve .
47011016	I repeat : let no one take me for a fool . But if you do , then tolerate me just as you would a fool , so that I may do a little boasting .
47011017	In this self-confident boasting I am not talking as the Lord would , but as a fool .
47011018	Since many are boasting in the way the world does , I too will boast .
47011019	You gladly put up with fools since you are so wise !
47011020	In fact , you even put up with anyone who enslaves you or exploits you or takes advantage of you or puts on airs or slaps you in the face .
47011021	To my shame I admit that we were too weak for that ! Whatever anyone else dares to boast about – I am speaking as a fool – I also dare to boast about .
47011022	Are they Hebrews ? So am I . Are they Israelites ? So am I . Are they Abraham’s descendants ? So am I .
47011023	Are they servants of Christ ? ( I am out of my mind to talk like this . ) I am more . I have worked much harder , been in prison more frequently , been flogged more severely , and been exposed to death again and again .
47011024	Five times I received from the Jews the forty lashes minus one .
47011025	Three times I was beaten with rods , once I was pelted with stones , three times I was shipwrecked , I spent a night and a day in the open sea ,
47011026	I have been constantly on the move . I have been in danger from rivers , in danger from bandits , in danger from my fellow Jews , in danger from Gentiles ; in danger in the city , in danger in the country , in danger at sea ; and in danger from false believers .
